ayah_en: So ignore those who turn away from Our revelation and seek nothing but the life of this world.

ayah_ar: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
ayah_en: That is the ultimate extent of their knowledge. Surely your Lord knows best those who stray from His path and He knows best those who follow His guidance.

ayah_ar: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔوا۟ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ بِٱلْحُسْنَى
ayah_en: Everything in the heavens and on the earth belongs to God and so He will requite those who do evil in accordance with their deeds and will reward those left with that which is best, for those who do good.

ayah_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌۭ فِى بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
ayah_en: As for those who refrain from committing grave sins and indecent acts, though they may commit minor offences, your Lord is unstinting in His forgiveness. He knows you when He brings you out of the earth, and when you were embryos in the wombs of your mothers; so do not make claims to be pure. He knows best who is truly righteous.

ayah_ar: أَفَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى تَوَلَّىٰ
ayah_en: Have you \[Prophet\] considered the man who turned away,

ayah_ar: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًۭا وَأَكْدَىٰٓ
ayah_en: who at first gave a little, then later held back?

ayah_ar: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ
ayah_en: Has he knowledge of the unseen, so that he sees?

ayah_ar: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِى صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
ayah_en: Has he not been made acquainted with what was written in the scriptures of Moses?

ayah_ar: وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِى وَفَّىٰٓ
ayah_en: And with Abraham who kept his word:

ayah_ar: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌۭ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ
ayah_en: that no soul shall bear the burden of another;

ayah_ar: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
ayah_en: and that man shall have only that for which he strives;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُۥ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ
ayah_en: and that \[the fruit of\] his striving shall soon be seen;

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ يُجْزَىٰهُ ٱلْجَزَآءَ ٱلْأَوْفَىٰ
ayah_en: and in the end he will be repaid for it in full;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ
ayah_en: that all things in the end shall return to God;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ
ayah_en: that it is He who brings laughter and tears;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا
ayah_en: that it is He who causes death and gives life;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰ
ayah_en: and that He Himself created the two sexes: male and female,

ayah_ar: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ
ayah_en: from an ejected drop of sperm;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُخْرَىٰ
ayah_en: and that He will bring about the Second Creation;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ
ayah_en: that it is He who gives wealth and possessions;

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعْرَىٰ
ayah_en: that He is the Lord of Sirius.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا ٱلْأُولَىٰ
ayah_en: It was He who totally destroyed the former 'Ad

ayah_ar: وَثَمُودَا۟ فَمَآ أَبْقَىٰ
ayah_en: and Thamud tribes,

ayah_ar: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍۢ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
ayah_en: and before them the people of Noah who were even more unjust and insolent;

ayah_ar: وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ
ayah_en: and He overthrew the subverted cities \[of Sodom and Gomorrah\]

ayah_ar: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
ayah_en: and then covered them from sight forever.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ
ayah_en: On which then of your Lord's signs do you cast doubt?

ayah_ar: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلْأُولَىٰٓ
ayah_en: This is a warning just like those of former times.

ayah_ar: أَزِفَتِ ٱلْءَازِفَةُ
ayah_en: The Hour that was to come draws ever nearer.

ayah_ar: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
ayah_en: None but God can avert it.

ayah_ar: أَفَمِنْ هَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ
ayah_en: Do you then find these tidings strange?

ayah_ar: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ
ayah_en: Why do you laugh rather than weep?

ayah_ar: وَأَنتُمْ سَٰمِدُونَ
ayah_en: Will you remain proudly heedless?

ayah_ar: فَٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ وَٱعْبُدُوا۟ ۩
ayah_en: Prostrate yourselves before God, and worship Him alone!

ayah_ar: ٱقْتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلْقَمَرُ
ayah_en: The Last Hour draws near and the moon is split asunder.

ayah_ar: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ ءَايَةًۭ يُعْرِضُوا۟ وَيَقُولُوا۟ سِحْرٌۭ مُّسْتَمِرٌّۭ
ayah_en: Yet, when they see a sign they \[who deny the truth\] turn their backs and say, "The same old sorcery!"

ayah_ar: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍۢ مُّسْتَقِرٌّۭ
ayah_en: They deny the truth and follow their own whims, every matter has its appointed time,

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
ayah_en: there has come to them many a tiding wherein there are warnings,

ayah_ar: حِكْمَةٌۢ بَٰلِغَةٌۭ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
ayah_en: profound in wisdom, but all warnings have been of no avail:

ayah_ar: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَىْءٍۢ نُّكُرٍ
ayah_en: so ignore them. On the Day when the Crier will call out about a horrible event,

ayah_ar: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌۭ مُّنتَشِرٌۭ
ayah_en: with downcast eyes they shall come out of their graves, as if they were locusts milling about

ayah_ar: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌۭ
ayah_en: hastening towards the Crier. Those who deny the truth will cry, "This is such a hard day!"

ayah_ar: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍۢ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا۟ مَجْنُونٌۭ وَٱزْدُجِرَ
ayah_en: The people of Noah denied \[the truth\] before them. They belied Our messenger saying, "He is mad!" He was rebuffed,

ayah_ar: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَغْلُوبٌۭ فَٱنتَصِرْ
ayah_en: so he cried out to his Lord, saying, "I am overcome, so help me!"

ayah_ar: فَفَتَحْنَآ أَبْوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٍۢ مُّنْهَمِرٍۢ
ayah_en: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,

ayah_ar: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًۭا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍۢ قَدْ قُدِرَ
ayah_en: and We caused the earth to burst with gushing springs: so that the waters met for a purpose which had been decreed.

ayah_ar: وَحَمَلْنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَٰحٍۢ وَدُسُرٍۢ
ayah_en: We bore him on an \[ark\] which, made of planks and nails,

ayah_ar: تَجْرِى بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَآءًۭ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
ayah_en: floated on under Our eyes: a vindication of him who had been rejected.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَٰهَآ ءَايَةًۭ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
ayah_en: We have left this as a sign: but will anyone take heed?

ayah_ar: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
ayah_en: How terrible then was My punishment and My warning.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
ayah_en: We have made it easy to learn lessons from the Quran. Is there anyone who would receive admonition?

ayah_ar: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌۭ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
ayah_en: The people of 'Ad too rejected the truth. How terrible was My punishment and My warning.

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًۭا صَرْصَرًۭا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍۢ مُّسْتَمِرٍّۢ
ayah_en: We sent a raging wind against them on a day of continuous calamity.

ayah_ar: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍۢ مُّنقَعِرٍۢ
ayah_en: It swept people away as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.

ayah_ar: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
ayah_en: How \[dreadful\] was My punishment and My warning!

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
ayah_en: We have made it easy to learn lessons from the Quran: is there anyone who would receive admonition?

ayah_ar: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
ayah_en: The tribe of Thamud also rejected Our warnings:

ayah_ar: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرًۭا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدًۭا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًۭا لَّفِى ضَلَٰلٍۢ وَسُعُرٍ
ayah_en: they said, "Are we to follow a man from amongst ourselves? We would surely then fall into error and madness.

ayah_ar: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌۭ
ayah_en: Has the \[Divine\] message been revealed to him alone of all of us? No, he is a boastful liar."

ayah_ar: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًۭا مَّنِ ٱلْكَذَّابُ ٱلْأَشِرُ
ayah_en: \[We said to him\] "Tomorrow they shall know who is the boastful liar,

ayah_ar: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةًۭ لَّهُمْ فَٱرْتَقِبْهُمْ وَٱصْطَبِرْ
ayah_en: for We are \[going to\] send the she-camel as a trial for them, so watch them and be patient.

ayah_ar: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلْمَآءَ قِسْمَةٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍۢ مُّحْتَضَرٌۭ
ayah_en: And tell them that the water \[of the well\] is to be divided between them, and that each one should drink in turn."

ayah_ar: فَنَادَوْا۟ صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
ayah_en: But they called their companion who took a sword and hamstrung her.

ayah_ar: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
ayah_en: How \[terrible\] were My punishment and My warnings!

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ
ayah_en: Then We sent a single blast against them and they became like dry stubble which has been trampled upon.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
ayah_en: Indeed, We have made the Quran easy to learn lessons from. Is there anyone who would receive admonition?

ayah_ar: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
ayah_en: The people of Lot rejected Our warnings.

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍۢ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٍۢ
ayah_en: We sent a sandstorm against them which destroyed them all, except the family of Lot, whom We saved at the break of dawn,

ayah_ar: نِّعْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ
ayah_en: as a blessing from Us: this is how We reward the thankful.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
ayah_en: Lot warned them of Our punishment, but they disputed the warnings --

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِۦ فَطَمَسْنَآ أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
ayah_en: they even wanted to seduce his guests -- but We blinded them, and said, "Taste My punishment now that you have scorned My warnings!" --

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌۭ مُّسْتَقِرٌّۭ
ayah_en: and early in the morning the punishment decreed overtook them --

ayah_ar: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
ayah_en: "Taste My punishment now that you have scorned My warnings!"

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
ayah_en: We have made it easy indeed to learn lessons from the Quran. Is there anyone who would receive admonition?

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
ayah_en: Surely warners came to the people of Pharaoh.

ayah_ar: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَٰهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
ayah_en: They, too, rejected all Our signs. So We seized them with the seizure of One Mighty, Omnipotent.

ayah_ar: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٌۭ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
ayah_en: Are your people who deny the truth better than those? Or have you been given immunity in the Scriptures?

ayah_ar: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌۭ مُّنتَصِرٌۭ
ayah_en: Or do they say, "We are a united group, and we are bound to prevail?"

ayah_ar: سَيُهْزَمُ ٱلْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
ayah_en: The hosts shall soon be routed and they shall be put to flight.

ayah_ar: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
ayah_en: Indeed, the Hour of Doom is their appointed time, and the Last Hour will be the most severe, and the most bitter.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍۢ وَسُعُرٍۢ
ayah_en: The evil-doers are indeed sunk in error and folly --

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
ayah_en: on the Day when they are dragged into the fire on their faces, it will be said to them, "Now feel the touch of Hell!"

ayah_ar: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٍۢ
ayah_en: We have created everything in due measure;

ayah_ar: وَمَآ أَمْرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٌۭ كَلَمْحٍۭ بِٱلْبَصَرِ
ayah_en: We command but once: Our will is done in the twinkling of an eye;

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَآ أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍۢ
ayah_en: We have indeed destroyed many a people like you. Is there anyone who would receive admonition?

ayah_ar: وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍۢ فَعَلُوهُ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
ayah_en: All their deeds are recorded in their books:

ayah_ar: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍۢ وَكَبِيرٍۢ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
ayah_en: every action, small or great, is noted down.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّٰتٍۢ وَنَهَرٍۢ
ayah_en: The God-conscious will find themselves in gardens and rivers,

ayah_ar: فِى مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرٍۭ
ayah_en: in the seat of truth with an all-powerful sovereign.

ayah_ar: ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ
ayah_en: The Merciful

ayah_ar: عَلَّمَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ
ayah_en: who taught the Quran --

ayah_ar: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ
ayah_en: He created man

ayah_ar: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلْبَيَانَ
ayah_en: and He taught him speech.

ayah_ar: ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍۢ
ayah_en: The sun and the moon move according to a fixed reckoning;

ayah_ar: وَٱلنَّجْمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ
ayah_en: the stars and the trees bend in prostration.

ayah_ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
ayah_en: He raised the heavens and set up the measure,

ayah_ar: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْمِيزَانِ
ayah_en: so that you should not transgress the measure.

ayah_ar: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلْوَزْنَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا۟ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
ayah_en: Always measure with justice and do not give short measure.

ayah_ar: وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ
ayah_en: He has laid out the earth for His creatures.

ayah_ar: فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٌۭ وَٱلنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ ٱلْأَكْمَامِ
ayah_en: On it are fruits and palm-trees with sheathed clusters \[of dates\],

ayah_ar: وَٱلْحَبُّ ذُو ٱلْعَصْفِ وَٱلرَّيْحَانُ
ayah_en: and grains with their husk and fragrant plants.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلْصَٰلٍۢ كَٱلْفَخَّارِ
ayah_en: He has created man, from dry ringing clay, like the potter"s,

ayah_ar: وَخَلَقَ ٱلْجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٍۢ مِّن نَّارٍۢ
ayah_en: and He created the jinns from a flame of fire.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَغْرِبَيْنِ
ayah_en: He is the Lord of the two easts and the Lord of the two wests.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ
ayah_en: He has set the two oceans in motion, converging together.

ayah_ar: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌۭ لَّا يَبْغِيَانِ
ayah_en: Between them is a barrier, which they do not overrun.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا ٱللُّؤْلُؤُ وَٱلْمَرْجَانُ
ayah_en: Pearls and corals come forth from both of them.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which, of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: وَلَهُ ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ كَٱلْأَعْلَٰمِ
ayah_en: His are the lofty ships, that rear aloft on the sea like mountains.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍۢ
ayah_en: All that is on the earth is doomed to perish,

ayah_ar: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلْجَلَٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
ayah_en: while your Lord's own Self will remain full of majesty and glory.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: يَسْـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِى شَأْنٍۢ
ayah_en: Everyone in the heavens and on the earth entreats Him. Every day He manifests Himself in a new state.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ
ayah_en: Soon We shall attend to you -- two big groups \[of jinn and mankind\].

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: يَٰمَعْشَرَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنْ أَقْطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَٰنٍۢ
ayah_en: O company of jinn and men! If you have the power to go beyond the realms of the heavens and the earth, pass beyond them: you cannot pass out but with \[Our\] authority.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌۭ مِّن نَّارٍۢ وَنُحَاسٌۭ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
ayah_en: Flames of fire and molten brass shall be sent against both of you, and you will not be able to defend yourselves.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةًۭ كَٱلدِّهَانِ
ayah_en: When the sky is rent asunder, and becomes red like red leather,

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فَيَوْمَئِذٍۢ لَّا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٌۭ وَلَا جَآنٌّۭ
ayah_en: For, on that Day, neither man nor jinn will be questioned about his sins.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: يُعْرَفُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِى وَٱلْأَقْدَامِ
ayah_en: The guilty shall be recognized by their marks so they shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِى يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
ayah_en: This is the Hell which the guilty called a lie.

ayah_ar: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٍۢ
ayah_en: They will go round between its flames and boiling water.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
ayah_en: There are two gardens for one who fears standing before his Lord.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: ذَوَاتَآ أَفْنَانٍۢ
ayah_en: \[There will be two gardens with\] spreading branches.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ
ayah_en: In both of them, there are two springs flowing.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٍۢ زَوْجَانِ
ayah_en: In both of them, there will be two kinds of every fruit.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ ۚ وَجَنَى ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍۢ
ayah_en: They will recline upon carpets lined with rich brocade; and the fruits of both these gardens will be within easy reach.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌۭ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّۭ
ayah_en: Therein are maidens of modest gaze, whom neither a man nor a jinn had ever touched before them.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلْيَاقُوتُ وَٱلْمَرْجَانُ
ayah_en: \[There will be\] maidens as fair as corals and rubies.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: هَلْ جَزَآءُ ٱلْإِحْسَٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلْإِحْسَٰنُ
ayah_en: The reward of goodness shall be nothing but goodness.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ
ayah_en: Besides those two there shall be two other gardens.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: مُدْهَآمَّتَانِ
ayah_en: Both \[gardens\] of the darkest green.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ
ayah_en: In both of them live springs gush forth.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فِيهِمَا فَٰكِهَةٌۭ وَنَخْلٌۭ وَرُمَّانٌۭ
ayah_en: In both of them there will be fruit trees and date-palms and pomegranates.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَٰتٌ حِسَانٌۭ
ayah_en: Therein will be maidens chaste and beautiful.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: حُورٌۭ مَّقْصُورَٰتٌۭ فِى ٱلْخِيَامِ
ayah_en: \[There the blessed will live with their\] pure companions sheltered in pavilions.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌۭ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّۭ
ayah_en: Whom neither a man or jinn had ever touched before them.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍۢ وَعَبْقَرِىٍّ حِسَانٍۢ
ayah_en: \[They will live in such a paradise\] reclining upon green cushions and the finest carpets.

ayah_ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
ayah_en: Which of your Lord's wonders would you deny?

ayah_ar: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِى ٱلْجَلَٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
ayah_en: Blessed be your Lord's name, full of glory and majesty!

ayah_ar: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ
ayah_en: When the inevitable event takes place,

ayah_ar: لَيْسَ لِوَقْعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ
ayah_en: and there can be no denying its happening,

ayah_ar: خَافِضَةٌۭ رَّافِعَةٌ
ayah_en: some shall be abased and others exalted.

ayah_ar: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ رَجًّۭا
ayah_en: When the earth is shaken violently,

ayah_ar: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ بَسًّۭا
ayah_en: and the mountains are totally shattered and crumble to pieces

ayah_ar: فَكَانَتْ هَبَآءًۭ مُّنۢبَثًّۭا
ayah_en: and become like scattered dust particles,

ayah_ar: وَكُنتُمْ أَزْوَٰجًۭا ثَلَٰثَةًۭ
ayah_en: \[on that Day\] you shall be divided into three groups.

ayah_ar: فَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ
ayah_en: Those on the Right -- how blessed are those on the Right!

ayah_ar: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
ayah_en: Those on the Left -- how unlucky are those on the Left!

ayah_ar: وَٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ
ayah_en: The third to the fore shall be the foremost.

ayah_ar: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
ayah_en: They shall be the nearest to God.

ayah_ar: فِى جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayah_en: They will dwell in the Gardens of Bliss:

ayah_ar: ثُلَّةٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayah_en: a large group of the early believers,

ayah_ar: وَقَلِيلٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
ayah_en: and a lesser number from the later generations.

ayah_ar: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍۢ مَّوْضُونَةٍۢ
ayah_en: Seated on couches wrought in gold and encrusted with precious stones,

ayah_ar: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَيْهَا مُتَقَٰبِلِينَ
ayah_en: reclining on them facing each other;

ayah_ar: يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌۭ مُّخَلَّدُونَ
ayah_en: they will be waited on by ageless youths

ayah_ar: بِأَكْوَابٍۢ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأْسٍۢ مِّن مَّعِينٍۢ
ayah_en: carrying goblets and ewers and cups filled with the purest wine,

ayah_ar: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنْهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ
ayah_en: neither causing headaches, nor intoxication;

ayah_ar: وَفَٰكِهَةٍۢ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ
ayah_en: along with fruits of their choice;

ayah_ar: وَلَحْمِ طَيْرٍۢ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
ayah_en: and the meat of any bird that they may desire;

ayah_ar: وَحُورٌ عِينٌۭ
ayah_en: and fair maidens with large, lustrous eyes

ayah_ar: كَأَمْثَٰلِ ٱللُّؤْلُؤِ ٱلْمَكْنُونِ
ayah_en: like the pearls in their shells:

ayah_ar: جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: shall be their recompense for their deeds.

ayah_ar: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًۭا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
ayah_en: They will not hear therein any vain or sinful talk,

ayah_ar: إِلَّا قِيلًۭا سَلَٰمًۭا سَلَٰمًۭا
ayah_en: only the words of peace and tranquillity.

ayah_ar: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْيَمِينِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayah_en: Those on the Right, how fortunate are those on the Right!

ayah_ar: فِى سِدْرٍۢ مَّخْضُودٍۢ
ayah_en: They shall recline on high amidst lote trees without thorns

ayah_ar: وَطَلْحٍۢ مَّنضُودٍۢ
ayah_en: and clustered bananas,

ayah_ar: وَظِلٍّۢ مَّمْدُودٍۢ
ayah_en: and spreading shade

ayah_ar: وَمَآءٍۢ مَّسْكُوبٍۢ
ayah_en: and flowing water,

ayah_ar: وَفَٰكِهَةٍۢ كَثِيرَةٍۢ
ayah_en: and fruits in abundance,

ayah_ar: لَّا مَقْطُوعَةٍۢ وَلَا مَمْنُوعَةٍۢ
ayah_en: never-ending and unrestricted,

ayah_ar: وَفُرُشٍۢ مَّرْفُوعَةٍ
ayah_en: on raised couches.

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَنشَأْنَٰهُنَّ إِنشَآءًۭ
ayah_en: We have created maidens perfectly

ayah_ar: فَجَعَلْنَٰهُنَّ أَبْكَارًا
ayah_en: and made them virgins,

ayah_ar: عُرُبًا أَتْرَابًۭا
ayah_en: loving companions, matching in age,

ayah_ar: لِّأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayah_en: for those on the Right,

ayah_ar: ثُلَّةٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayah_en: a large group of the earlier people

ayah_ar: وَثُلَّةٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
ayah_en: and a large group of those of later times.

ayah_ar: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ
ayah_en: Those on the Left: how unfortunate are those on the Left!

ayah_ar: فِى سَمُومٍۢ وَحَمِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: They will find themselves in scorching wind and scalding water,

ayah_ar: وَظِلٍّۢ مِّن يَحْمُومٍۢ
ayah_en: and under the shadow of black smoke,

ayah_ar: لَّا بَارِدٍۢ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ
ayah_en: neither cool nor refreshing.

ayah_ar: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ
ayah_en: They had been affluent before,

ayah_ar: وَكَانُوا۟ يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلْحِنثِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: and they persisted obstinately in awful sin,

ayah_ar: وَكَانُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًۭا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
ayah_en: and they used to say, "What! After we have died and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be raised up again?

ayah_ar: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ
ayah_en: And also our forefathers?"

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ وَٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
ayah_en: Say, "Indeed, the earlier ones and the later ones

ayah_ar: لَمَجْمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَٰتِ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
ayah_en: will indeed be gathered together at a fixed time on an appointed Day.

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ ٱلْمُكَذِّبُونَ
ayah_en: Then you, you misguided ones, who deny the truth,

ayah_ar: لَءَاكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٍۢ مِّن زَقُّومٍۢ
ayah_en: shall eat the fruit of the tree of Zaqqum,

ayah_ar: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
ayah_en: and fill your bellies with it,

ayah_ar: فَشَٰرِبُونَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلْحَمِيمِ
ayah_en: and shall drink boiling water on top of that.

ayah_ar: فَشَٰرِبُونَ شُرْبَ ٱلْهِيمِ
ayah_en: You shall drink it as the thirsty camels drink."

ayah_ar: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
ayah_en: This shall be their entertainment on the Day of Judgement.

ayah_ar: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰكُمْ فَلَوْلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ
ayah_en: We have created you: why then do you not accept the truth?

ayah_ar: أَفَرَءَيْتُم مَّا تُمْنُونَ
ayah_en: Have you thought about \[the semen\] that you discharge --

ayah_ar: ءَأَنتُمْ تَخْلُقُونَهُۥٓ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْخَٰلِقُونَ
ayah_en: did you create it or did We?

ayah_ar: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
ayah_en: It is We who have ordained death for all of you; and We cannot be prevented

ayah_ar: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَٰلَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِى مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: from replacing you by others like yourselves or changing your forms and re-creating you in forms that you know nothing of.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayah_en: You have certainly known the first creation. Why, then, do you not take heed?

ayah_ar: أَفَرَءَيْتُم مَّا تَحْرُثُونَ
ayah_en: Have you thought about what crops you plant?

ayah_ar: ءَأَنتُمْ تَزْرَعُونَهُۥٓ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلزَّٰرِعُونَ
ayah_en: Is it you who cause them to grow or do We?

ayah_ar: لَوْ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلْنَٰهُ حُطَٰمًۭا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
ayah_en: If We so pleased, We could turn your harvest into chaff. Then you would start lamenting,

ayah_ar: إِنَّا لَمُغْرَمُونَ
ayah_en: "We are ruined,

ayah_ar: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
ayah_en: nay, we are deprived \[altogether\]."

ayah_ar: أَفَرَءَيْتُمُ ٱلْمَآءَ ٱلَّذِى تَشْرَبُونَ
ayah_en: Have you considered the water that you drink?

ayah_ar: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنزِلُونَ
ayah_en: Is it you who cause it to descend from the clouds, or do We?

ayah_ar: لَوْ نَشَآءُ جَعَلْنَٰهُ أُجَاجًۭا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
ayah_en: If We so pleased, We certainly could make it salty. Why, then, are you not grateful?

ayah_ar: أَفَرَءَيْتُمُ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِى تُورُونَ
ayah_en: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle.

ayah_ar: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنشِـُٔونَ
ayah_en: Did you produce the tree that serves as fuel or do We?

ayah_ar: نَحْنُ جَعَلْنَٰهَا تَذْكِرَةًۭ وَمَتَٰعًۭا لِّلْمُقْوِينَ
ayah_en: We have made it to be a reminder and a benefit for the wayfarers.

ayah_ar: فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Supreme.

ayah_ar: ۞ فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِمَوَٰقِعِ ٱلنُّجُومِ
ayah_en: Nay, I swear by the setting of the stars --

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَقَسَمٌۭ لَّوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ
ayah_en: and, indeed, that is a most mighty oath, if you only knew --

ayah_ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقُرْءَانٌۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: that this is indeed a noble Quran,

ayah_ar: فِى كِتَٰبٍۢ مَّكْنُونٍۢ
ayah_en: in a well-guarded preserved Book,

ayah_ar: لَّا يَمَسُّهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْمُطَهَّرُونَ
ayah_en: which none can touch except the purified.

ayah_ar: تَنزِيلٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
ayah_en: It is a revelation sent down from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah_ar: أَفَبِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ أَنتُم مُّدْهِنُونَ
ayah_en: How can you regard this discourse with disdain?

ayah_ar: وَتَجْعَلُونَ رِزْقَكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ تُكَذِّبُونَ
ayah_en: Do you make its denial your means of livelihood?

ayah_ar: فَلَوْلَآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلْحُلْقُومَ
ayah_en: Why, then, when the soul of the dying man reaches the throat,

ayah_ar: وَأَنتُمْ حِينَئِذٍۢ تَنظُرُونَ
ayah_en: and you are \[at that moment\] looking on \[helplessly\] --

ayah_ar: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنكُمْ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُبْصِرُونَ
ayah_en: and We are nearer to him than you, although you cannot see Us --

ayah_ar: فَلَوْلَآ إِن كُنتُمْ غَيْرَ مَدِينِينَ
ayah_en: why, then, if you are not subject to Our command,

ayah_ar: تَرْجِعُونَهَآ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
ayah_en: do you not cause the soul to return to him if you are truthful in your claim?

ayah_ar: فَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
ayah_en: But if he \[the dying person\] is one of those brought near to God,

ayah_ar: فَرَوْحٌۭ وَرَيْحَانٌۭ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: then for him there shall be comfort and plenty and a Garden of Bliss;

ayah_ar: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayah_en: and if he is of those who are on the Right,

ayah_ar: فَسَلَٰمٌۭ لَّكَ مِنْ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayah_en: he will be greeted with, "Peace be to you," by those on the Right.

ayah_ar: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
ayah_en: But if he is one of those who rejected \[the truth\] and went astray,

ayah_ar: فَنُزُلٌۭ مِّنْ حَمِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: he will be welcomed with boiling water.

ayah_ar: وَتَصْلِيَةُ جَحِيمٍ
ayah_en: He will burn in Hell.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ ٱلْيَقِينِ
ayah_en: This is indeed the indubitable truth.

ayah_ar: فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Supreme.

ayah_ar: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: Everything in the heavens and earth glorifies God -- He is the Mighty, the Wise One.

ayah_ar: لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌ
ayah_en: He has sovereign control over the heavens and the earth. He gives life and brings death. He has power over all things.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلْأَوَّلُ وَٱلْءَاخِرُ وَٱلظَّٰهِرُ وَٱلْبَاطِنُ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
ayah_en: He is the First and the Last, the Outward and the Inward. He has knowledge of all things.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمَا يَنزِلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا يَعْرُجُ فِيهَا ۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: It was He who created the heavens and earth in six Days \[periods\] and then ascended the throne. He knows what enters the earth and what comes out of it; what descends from the sky and what ascends to it. He is with you wherever you are; He sees all that you do;

ayah_ar: لَّهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ ٱلْأُمُورُ
ayah_en: He has sovereignty over the heavens and the earth. All affairs will return to God.

ayah_ar: يُولِجُ ٱلَّيْلَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِى ٱلَّيْلِ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
ayah_en: He causes the night to pass into the day and the day to pass into the night. And He knows all that is in the hearts of men.

ayah_ar: ءَامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَأَنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا جَعَلَكُم مُّسْتَخْلَفِينَ فِيهِ ۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنكُمْ وَأَنفَقُوا۟ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌۭ كَبِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Have faith in God and His Messenger and spend in charity from that of which He has made you trustees: those of you who believe and give alms shall be richly rewarded.

ayah_ar: وَمَا لَكُمْ لَا تُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ ۙ وَٱلرَّسُولُ يَدْعُوكُمْ لِتُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِرَبِّكُمْ وَقَدْ أَخَذَ مِيثَٰقَكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayah_en: What could be your reason for not believing in God, when the Messenger calls on you to have faith in your Lord and He has already made a covenant with you, if indeed you are true believers?

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِۦٓ ءَايَٰتٍۭ بَيِّنَٰتٍۢ لِّيُخْرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: It is He who sends down to His Servant clear revelations, so that He may lead you out of darkness into light. God is indeed compassionate and merciful to you.

ayah_ar: وَمَا لَكُمْ أَلَّا تُنفِقُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَٰثُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا يَسْتَوِى مِنكُم مَّنْ أَنفَقَ مِن قَبْلِ ٱلْفَتْحِ وَقَٰتَلَ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَعْظَمُ دَرَجَةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنفَقُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدُ وَقَٰتَلُوا۟ ۚ وَكُلًّۭا وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Why should you not spend for the cause of God, when God alone holds the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Those of you who spent and fought before the victory will be higher in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards. Yet God has promised you all a good reward. He is aware of all that you do.

ayah_ar: مَّن ذَا ٱلَّذِى يُقْرِضُ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًۭا فَيُضَٰعِفَهُۥ لَهُۥ وَلَهُۥٓ أَجْرٌۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Who will offer God a generous loan? He will double it for him and give him a rich reward.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ تَرَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ يَسْعَىٰ نُورُهُم بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَٰنِهِم بُشْرَىٰكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ جَنَّٰتٌۭ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
ayah_en: On the Day, you \[Prophet\] shall see the faithful, both men and women, with their light streaming out before them and on their right hands, \[and you shall hear a voice saying to them:\] "Glad tidings for you today! You shall enter gardens with rivers flowing through them wherein you shall forever dwell. That is the supreme triumph."

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يَقُولُ ٱلْمُنَٰفِقُونَ وَٱلْمُنَٰفِقَٰتُ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱنظُرُونَا نَقْتَبِسْ مِن نُّورِكُمْ قِيلَ ٱرْجِعُوا۟ وَرَآءَكُمْ فَٱلْتَمِسُوا۟ نُورًۭا فَضُرِبَ بَيْنَهُم بِسُورٍۢ لَّهُۥ بَابٌۢ بَاطِنُهُۥ فِيهِ ٱلرَّحْمَةُ وَظَٰهِرُهُۥ مِن قِبَلِهِ ٱلْعَذَابُ
ayah_en: On that Day, the hypocrites, both men and women, will say to the faithful, "Wait a while for us, so that we may have some of your light." They will be told, "Turn back and look for a light elsewhere." A wall will then be raised between them. It will have a gate on the inside of which will be grace and mercy and on the outside of which will be punishment.

ayah_ar: يُنَادُونَهُمْ أَلَمْ نَكُن مَّعَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمْ فَتَنتُمْ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَتَرَبَّصْتُمْ وَٱرْتَبْتُمْ وَغَرَّتْكُمُ ٱلْأَمَانِىُّ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْغَرُورُ
ayah_en: The hypocrites will call out to the faithful: "Were we not on your side?" They will reply, "Yes, but you gave in to temptation, you wavered and doubted and were deceived by your wishful thinking until God's will was done; then the Deceiver \[Satan\] misled you about God."

ayah_ar: فَٱلْيَوْمَ لَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنكُمْ فِدْيَةٌۭ وَلَا مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۚ مَأْوَىٰكُمُ ٱلنَّارُ ۖ هِىَ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: So this Day no ransom can be taken from you nor from those who were bent on denying the truth. Your home is the fire; that is your companion, and a hapless journey's end.

ayah_ar: ۞ أَلَمْ يَأْنِ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَن تَخْشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمْ لِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا نَزَلَ مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا يَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبْلُ فَطَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْأَمَدُ فَقَسَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ فَٰسِقُونَ
ayah_en: Has the time not come for the faithful when their hearts in all humility should engage in the remembrance of God and of the revelation of truth, so that they should not become like those who were given the Book before them, whose hearts with the passage of time became hardened and many of whom were disobedient?

ayah_ar: ٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحْىِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ ٱلْءَايَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
ayah_en: Remember that God brings the earth back to life after its death. We have made Our signs clear to you, so that you may fully understand.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُصَّدِّقِينَ وَٱلْمُصَّدِّقَٰتِ وَأَقْرَضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًۭا يُضَٰعَفُ لَهُمْ وَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Alms-givers, both men and women, who give a generous loan to God, shall have it multiplied and shall have an honourable reward.

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦٓ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصِّدِّيقُونَ ۖ وَٱلشُّهَدَآءُ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ وَنُورُهُمْ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayah_en: Those who believe in God and His messengers are the truthful ones and the witnesses in the sight of their Lord. They shall have their reward and their light. But those who are bent on denying the truth and reject Our signs shall be destined for Hell.

ayah_ar: ٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا لَعِبٌۭ وَلَهْوٌۭ وَزِينَةٌۭ وَتَفَاخُرٌۢ بَيْنَكُمْ وَتَكَاثُرٌۭ فِى ٱلْأَمْوَٰلِ وَٱلْأَوْلَٰدِ ۖ كَمَثَلِ غَيْثٍ أَعْجَبَ ٱلْكُفَّارَ نَبَاتُهُۥ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَىٰهُ مُصْفَرًّۭا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَٰمًۭا ۖ وَفِى ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ عَذَابٌۭ شَدِيدٌۭ وَمَغْفِرَةٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضْوَٰنٌۭ ۚ وَمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَآ إِلَّا مَتَٰعُ ٱلْغُرُورِ
ayah_en: Never forget that the life of this world is only a game and a passing delight, a show, and mutual boasting and trying to outrival each other in riches and children. It is like the growth of vegetation after the rain, which delights the planter, but which then withers away, turns yellow and becomes worthless stubble. In the life to come there will be a terrible punishment, or God's forgiveness and approval: the life of this world is nothing but means of deception.

ayah_ar: سَابِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَغْفِرَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرْضُهَا كَعَرْضِ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أُعِدَّتْ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: Vie with one another for your Lord's forgiveness and for a Paradise as vast as heaven and earth, which has been made ready for those who believe in God and His messengers. Such is God's grace. He bestows it upon whoever He pleases. There is no limit to God's bounty.

ayah_ar: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٍۢ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِىٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ إِلَّا فِى كِتَٰبٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِ أَن نَّبْرَأَهَآ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: No misfortune can affect the earth or your own selves without its first having been recorded in a book, before We bring it into being. That is easy for God to do;

ayah_ar: لِّكَيْلَا تَأْسَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا تَفْرَحُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍۢ فَخُورٍ
ayah_en: so that you may not grieve for what has escaped you, nor be exultant over what you have gained. God loves neither the conceited nor the boastful,

ayah_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يَبْخَلُونَ وَيَأْمُرُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ بِٱلْبُخْلِ ۗ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
ayah_en: nor those who, being miserly themselves, urge others to be miserly. He who turns his back should remember that God alone is self-sufficient and worthy of all praise.

ayah_ar: لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا بِٱلْبَيِّنَٰتِ وَأَنزَلْنَا مَعَهُمُ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَٱلْمِيزَانَ لِيَقُومَ ٱلنَّاسُ بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۖ وَأَنزَلْنَا ٱلْحَدِيدَ فِيهِ بَأْسٌۭ شَدِيدٌۭ وَمَنَٰفِعُ لِلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُۥ وَرُسُلَهُۥ بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِىٌّ عَزِيزٌۭ
ayah_en: We sent Our messengers with evidence and, with them, We sent down the Book and the Scales of Justice, so that men might act in all fairness. We sent down iron with its great inherent strength and its many benefits for mankind, so that God might know who would stand up for God, though unseen, and His messengers. God is powerful, and almighty.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًۭا وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِى ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا ٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَٱلْكِتَٰبَ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مُّهْتَدٍۢ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ فَٰسِقُونَ
ayah_en: We sent forth Noah and Abraham and bestowed upon their offspring prophethood and the Book. Some of them were rightly guided, but many others were transgressors.

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ قَفَّيْنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِم بِرُسُلِنَا وَقَفَّيْنَا بِعِيسَى ٱبْنِ مَرْيَمَ وَءَاتَيْنَٰهُ ٱلْإِنجِيلَ وَجَعَلْنَا فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوهُ رَأْفَةًۭ وَرَحْمَةًۭ وَرَهْبَانِيَّةً ٱبْتَدَعُوهَا مَا كَتَبْنَٰهَا عَلَيْهِمْ إِلَّا ٱبْتِغَآءَ رِضْوَٰنِ ٱللَّهِ فَمَا رَعَوْهَا حَقَّ رِعَايَتِهَا ۖ فَـَٔاتَيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ أَجْرَهُمْ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ فَٰسِقُونَ
ayah_en: Then, in their wake, We followed them up with \[others of\] Our messengers and after them Jesus, son of Mary. We gave him the Gospel and imbued the hearts of those who followed him with compassion and mercy. But We did not prescribe monasticism for them: that was their own innovation by which they sought to please God. But then, they did not observe it in the way that it should have been observed. So We rewarded only those who were truly faithful, for many of them were disobedient.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَءَامِنُوا۟ بِرَسُولِهِۦ يُؤْتِكُمْ كِفْلَيْنِ مِن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ نُورًۭا تَمْشُونَ بِهِۦ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Believers, fear God and believe in His messenger. He will show you mercy in double measure and will provide a light for you to walk in. God will grant you forgiveness. He is forgiving and merciful.

ayah_ar: لِّئَلَّا يَعْلَمَ أَهْلُ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ أَلَّا يَقْدِرُونَ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍۢ مِّن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ ۙ وَأَنَّ ٱلْفَضْلَ بِيَدِ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: The People of the Book should know that they have no power whatsoever over God's grace. His grace is entirely in His hand and He bestows it upon whoever He wills. God is truly infinite in His bounty.

ayah_ar: قَدْ سَمِعَ ٱللَّهُ قَوْلَ ٱلَّتِى تُجَٰدِلُكَ فِى زَوْجِهَا وَتَشْتَكِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَٱللَّهُ يَسْمَعُ تَحَاوُرَكُمَآ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌۢ بَصِيرٌ
ayah_en: God has indeed heard the words of the woman who pleads with you about her husband and lays her complaint before God: God hears what the two of you have to say. God is all hearing, all seeing.

ayah_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يُظَٰهِرُونَ مِنكُم مِّن نِّسَآئِهِم مَّا هُنَّ أُمَّهَٰتِهِمْ ۖ إِنْ أُمَّهَٰتُهُمْ إِلَّا ٱلَّٰٓـِٔى وَلَدْنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَيَقُولُونَ مُنكَرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ وَزُورًۭا ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٌۭ
ayah_en: Those who separate themselves from their wives by pronouncing, "To me you are like my mother's back," must concede that they are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave birth to them -- surely they utter an evil word and a lie. God is pardoning, forgiving.

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُظَٰهِرُونَ مِن نِّسَآئِهِمْ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا قَالُوا۟ فَتَحْرِيرُ رَقَبَةٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ تُوعَظُونَ بِهِۦ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Those who put away their wives by equating them with their mothers, and then wish to go back on what they have said, must set free a slave before the couple may touch one another again. This is what you are exhorted to do. God is fully aware of what you do,

ayah_ar: فَمَن لَّمْ يَجِدْ فَصِيَامُ شَهْرَيْنِ مُتَتَابِعَيْنِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّا ۖ فَمَن لَّمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَإِطْعَامُ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِينًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِتُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ۚ وَتِلْكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَلِلْكَٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
ayah_en: and anyone who does not have the means must fast for two consecutive months before they touch each other, and who is not able to do that must feed sixty needy people. That is to affirm your faith in God and His messenger. These are the limits set by God. Those who deny the truth shall have a painful punishment.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُحَآدُّونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ كُبِتُوا۟ كَمَا كُبِتَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ وَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَآ ءَايَٰتٍۭ بَيِّنَٰتٍۢ ۚ وَلِلْكَٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
ayah_en: Those who oppose God and His Messenger will be humiliated, as were their predecessors. We have sent down clear revelations. A humiliating punishment awaits those who deny the truth.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يَبْعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعًۭا فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوٓا۟ ۚ أَحْصَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ وَنَسُوهُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ شَهِيدٌ
ayah_en: On the day God raises them all up from the dead, He will make them understand what they have done. God has taken everything into account, even though they have forgotten, for God is a witness to all things.

ayah_ar: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ مَا يَكُونُ مِن نَّجْوَىٰ ثَلَٰثَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ رَابِعُهُمْ وَلَا خَمْسَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ سَادِسُهُمْ وَلَآ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكْثَرَ إِلَّا هُوَ مَعَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كَانُوا۟ ۖ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
ayah_en: Do you not see that God knows all that is in the heavens and on the earth? There is not a secret consultation between three, but He makes the fourth among them -- nor between five but He makes the sixth -- nor between fewer nor more, but He is in their midst, wherever they may be: in the end He will tell them the truth about their conduct, on the Day of Judgement. For God has full knowledge of all things.

ayah_ar: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ نُهُوا۟ عَنِ ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا نُهُوا۟ عَنْهُ وَيَتَنَٰجَوْنَ بِٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْعُدْوَٰنِ وَمَعْصِيَتِ ٱلرَّسُولِ وَإِذَا جَآءُوكَ حَيَّوْكَ بِمَا لَمْ يُحَيِّكَ بِهِ ٱللَّهُ وَيَقُولُونَ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَوْلَا يُعَذِّبُنَا ٱللَّهُ بِمَا نَقُولُ ۚ حَسْبُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ يَصْلَوْنَهَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: Have you not seen how those who were forbidden to hold secret counsels yet revert to that which they were forbidden to do? And they conspire to indulge in wrongdoing, aggressive behaviour and disobedience to the Messenger. When they come to you, they greet you, but not in the words God would use, and inwardly they wonder, "Why does God not punish us for what we say?" Hell will be a fitting punishment for them: they will burn in its flames -- a wretched fate!

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا تَنَٰجَيْتُمْ فَلَا تَتَنَٰجَوْا۟ بِٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْعُدْوَٰنِ وَمَعْصِيَتِ ٱلرَّسُولِ وَتَنَٰجَوْا۟ بِٱلْبِرِّ وَٱلتَّقْوَىٰ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِىٓ إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
ayah_en: Believers, when you confer together in private, do not confer in support of sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger, but confer for the promotion of virtue and righteousness. Fear God, before whom you shall all be gathered.

ayah_ar: إِنَّمَا ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ لِيَحْزُنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَيْسَ بِضَآرِّهِمْ شَيْـًٔا إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
ayah_en: Conspiracy for evil purposes is the work of Satan, by which he means to bring grief to believers. But he cannot harm them in the least, unless it be by God's leave. Let the believers put their trust in God.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَكُمْ تَفَسَّحُوا۟ فِى ٱلْمَجَٰلِسِ فَٱفْسَحُوا۟ يَفْسَحِ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا قِيلَ ٱنشُزُوا۟ فَٱنشُزُوا۟ يَرْفَعِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنكُمْ وَٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ دَرَجَٰتٍۢ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Believers, if you are told to make room for one another in your assemblies, then do so, and God will make room for you, and if you are told to rise up, do so: God will raise in rank those of you who believe and those who have been given knowledge: He is fully aware of all that you do.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا نَٰجَيْتُمُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَقَدِّمُوا۟ بَيْنَ يَدَىْ نَجْوَىٰكُمْ صَدَقَةًۭ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ وَأَطْهَرُ ۚ فَإِن لَّمْ تَجِدُوا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌ
ayah_en: Believers, when you come to consult the Messenger privately, give something in charity beforehand. That is best for you and most conducive to purity. But if you cannot find anything to give, know that God is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah_ar: ءَأَشْفَقْتُمْ أَن تُقَدِّمُوا۟ بَيْنَ يَدَىْ نَجْوَىٰكُمْ صَدَقَٰتٍۢ ۚ فَإِذْ لَمْ تَفْعَلُوا۟ وَتَابَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمْ فَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: Do you fear that you will not \[be able to\] give in charity before your consultation? Then if you are unable to do so, \[know that\] God has turned to you in His mercy; then observe your prayers and pay the prescribed alms and obey God and His Messenger. God is aware of all that you do.

ayah_ar: ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ تَوَلَّوْا۟ قَوْمًا غَضِبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مَّا هُم مِّنكُمْ وَلَا مِنْهُمْ وَيَحْلِفُونَ عَلَى ٱلْكَذِبِ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: Do you not see those who have befriended a people who have brought down upon themselves the wrath of God? They are neither with you nor with them and they wittingly swear to falsehood.

ayah_ar: أَعَدَّ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًۭا شَدِيدًا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ سَآءَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: God has prepared a severe punishment for them; surely what they have done is evil.

ayah_ar: ٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ أَيْمَٰنَهُمْ جُنَّةًۭ فَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
ayah_en: They have used their oaths to cover up their misdeeds and have thus turned others away from the path of God. A humiliating punishment awaits them.

ayah_ar: لَّن تُغْنِىَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَٰلُهُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
ayah_en: Neither their wealth nor their children will be of the least avail \[in protecting them\] against God -- they are the inheritors of Hell, and there they shall remain forever.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يَبْعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعًۭا فَيَحْلِفُونَ لَهُۥ كَمَا يَحْلِفُونَ لَكُمْ ۖ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍ ۚ أَلَآ إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ ٱلْكَٰذِبُونَ
ayah_en: On the day God raises them all up from the dead, they will swear to Him just as they have sworn to you, thinking that they are on firm ground. But surely they are liars.

ayah_ar: ٱسْتَحْوَذَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ فَأَنسَىٰهُمْ ذِكْرَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ حِزْبُ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ ۚ أَلَآ إِنَّ حِزْبَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ هُمُ ٱلْخَٰسِرُونَ
ayah_en: Satan has got the better of them and has caused them to forget the remembrance of God. They have gone over to the side of the devil, and it is as the devil's partisans that they shall be the losers:

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُحَآدُّونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ فِى ٱلْأَذَلِّينَ
ayah_en: those who oppose God and His Messenger will \[on Judgement Day\] be among the most abased.

ayah_ar: كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَغْلِبَنَّ أَنَا۠ وَرُسُلِىٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِىٌّ عَزِيزٌۭ
ayah_en: God has decreed, "I and My messengers shall most certainly prevail." Truly God is Powerful and Almighty.

ayah_ar: لَّا تَجِدُ قَوْمًۭا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْءَاخِرِ يُوَآدُّونَ مَنْ حَآدَّ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَوْ كَانُوٓا۟ ءَابَآءَهُمْ أَوْ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ أَوْ إِخْوَٰنَهُمْ أَوْ عَشِيرَتَهُمْ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ كَتَبَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلْإِيمَٰنَ وَأَيَّدَهُم بِرُوحٍۢ مِّنْهُ ۖ وَيُدْخِلُهُمْ جَنَّٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ رَضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ حِزْبُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ أَلَآ إِنَّ حِزْبَ ٱللَّهِ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
ayah_en: You will find no believers in God and the Last Day consorting with those who oppose God and His Messenger, even though they be their fathers, their sons, their brothers or their close relatives. He has engraved faith on their very hearts and has strengthened them with a spirit of His own. He will usher them into Gardens through which rivers flow where they shall dwell forever. God is well-pleased with them and they are well pleased with Him. They are God's party. God's party shall surely enter into a state of bliss.

ayah_ar: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: Everything in the heavens and on the earth glorifies God. He is the Almighty, the All Wise.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَخْرَجَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ مِن دِيَٰرِهِمْ لِأَوَّلِ ٱلْحَشْرِ ۚ مَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن يَخْرُجُوا۟ ۖ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مَّانِعَتُهُمْ حُصُونُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ فَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَمْ يَحْتَسِبُوا۟ ۖ وَقَذَفَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلرُّعْبَ ۚ يُخْرِبُونَ بُيُوتَهُم بِأَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَيْدِى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ فَٱعْتَبِرُوا۟ يَٰٓأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَبْصَٰرِ
ayah_en: It was He who turned those People of the Book who denied the truth out of their homes in the first banishment. You never thought they would go, and they thought their strongholds would protect them against God. But God came upon them from where they least expected and cast such terror into their hearts that their houses were pulled down by their own hands as well as by the hands of the believers. Learn a lesson, then, you who are endowed with insight.

ayah_ar: وَلَوْلَآ أَن كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْجَلَآءَ لَعَذَّبَهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ عَذَابُ ٱلنَّارِ
ayah_en: If God had not prescribed exile for them, He would surely have punished them in this world. But they shall have the torment of Fire in the Hereafter,

ayah_ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ شَآقُّوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ ۖ وَمَن يُشَآقِّ ٱللَّهَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
ayah_en: because they set themselves against God and His Messenger: God is stern in His punishment of anyone who sets himself against Him.

ayah_ar: مَا قَطَعْتُم مِّن لِّينَةٍ أَوْ تَرَكْتُمُوهَا قَآئِمَةً عَلَىٰٓ أُصُولِهَا فَبِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِيُخْزِىَ ٱلْفَٰسِقِينَ
ayah_en: Whatever palm trees you cut down or left standing on their roots, it was by God's leave, so that He might disgrace the transgressors.

ayah_ar: وَمَآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ مِنْهُمْ فَمَآ أَوْجَفْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ خَيْلٍۢ وَلَا رِكَابٍۢ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُسَلِّطُ رُسُلَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Whatever God has given to His Messenger as spoils from them is by His grace; you spurred neither horse nor camel for them, but God gives power to His messengers over anyone He wills. God has power over all things --

ayah_ar: مَّآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْقُرَىٰ فَلِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسُولِ وَلِذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَٰكِينِ وَٱبْنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ كَىْ لَا يَكُونَ دُولَةًۢ بَيْنَ ٱلْأَغْنِيَآءِ مِنكُمْ ۚ وَمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمُ ٱلرَّسُولُ فَخُذُوهُ وَمَا نَهَىٰكُمْ عَنْهُ فَٱنتَهُوا۟ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
ayah_en: whatever gains God has assigned to His Messenger from the inhabitants of the town is for God and for the Messenger and for his kinsfolk and for orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, so that they may not become the property of those of you who are rich. Whatever the Messenger gives you, take it; and whatever he forbids you, abstain from it. Fear God; surely, God is severe in retribution.

ayah_ar: لِلْفُقَرَآءِ ٱلْمُهَٰجِرِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُخْرِجُوا۟ مِن دِيَٰرِهِمْ وَأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًۭا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضْوَٰنًۭا وَيَنصُرُونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصَّٰدِقُونَ
ayah_en: It is for the poor refugees who were driven from their homes and possessions, desiring the favour and the pleasure of God and supporting God and His Messenger. Such people are the truthful.

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ تَبَوَّءُو ٱلدَّارَ وَٱلْإِيمَٰنَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ يُحِبُّونَ مَنْ هَاجَرَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَا يَجِدُونَ فِى صُدُورِهِمْ حَاجَةًۭ مِّمَّآ أُوتُوا۟ وَيُؤْثِرُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَلَوْ كَانَ بِهِمْ خَصَاصَةٌۭ ۚ وَمَن يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفْسِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
ayah_en: Those who were already settled in the city \[Madinah\] and firmly rooted in faith, love those who migrated to them for refuge, and harbour no desire in their hearts for what has been given to the \[latter\]. They give them preference over themselves, even if they too are needy: those who are saved from their own souls' greed are truly successful.

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ جَآءُو مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَٰنِنَا ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِٱلْإِيمَٰنِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِى قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّۭا لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٌۭ رَّحِيمٌ
ayah_en: Those who came \[into the faith\] after them say, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in the faith and leave no malice in our hearts towards those who believe. Lord, You are indeed compassionate and merciful."

ayah_ar: ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ نَافَقُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ لِإِخْوَٰنِهِمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ لَئِنْ أُخْرِجْتُمْ لَنَخْرُجَنَّ مَعَكُمْ وَلَا نُطِيعُ فِيكُمْ أَحَدًا أَبَدًۭا وَإِن قُوتِلْتُمْ لَنَنصُرَنَّكُمْ وَٱللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَٰذِبُونَ
ayah_en: Have you not seen those who act hypocritically? They say to their disbelieving companions from among the People of the Book, "If you are driven out we shall surely go out with you, and we shall never listen to anyone against you, and if war is waged against you, we shall help you." God bears witness that they are indeed liars.

ayah_ar: لَئِنْ أُخْرِجُوا۟ لَا يَخْرُجُونَ مَعَهُمْ وَلَئِن قُوتِلُوا۟ لَا يَنصُرُونَهُمْ وَلَئِن نَّصَرُوهُمْ لَيُوَلُّنَّ ٱلْأَدْبَٰرَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
ayah_en: If they are driven out, they will not go with them, nor, if they are attacked, will they help them. Indeed, if they go to their help, they will turn their backs in flight, and then they will not be helped.

ayah_ar: لَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ رَهْبَةًۭ فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌۭ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ
ayah_en: They are more in dread of you than of God, because they are people devoid of understanding.

ayah_ar: لَا يُقَٰتِلُونَكُمْ جَمِيعًا إِلَّا فِى قُرًۭى مُّحَصَّنَةٍ أَوْ مِن وَرَآءِ جُدُرٍۭ ۚ بَأْسُهُم بَيْنَهُمْ شَدِيدٌۭ ۚ تَحْسَبُهُمْ جَمِيعًۭا وَقُلُوبُهُمْ شَتَّىٰ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌۭ لَّا يَعْقِلُونَ
ayah_en: They will never fight against you in a body except from within fortified strongholds or from behind walls. There is much hostility between them. You think they are united, but their hearts are divided, because they are a people devoid of reason.

ayah_ar: كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ قَرِيبًۭا ۖ ذَاقُوا۟ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Like those who went just before them, they have tasted the evil consequences of their doings. And they shall have a painful punishment.

ayah_ar: كَمَثَلِ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ إِذْ قَالَ لِلْإِنسَٰنِ ٱكْفُرْ فَلَمَّا كَفَرَ قَالَ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّنكَ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
ayah_en: They are like Satan, who says to man, "Deny the truth!" but when man denied the truth, said, "I disown you; I fear God, the Lord of the Universe."

ayah_ar: فَكَانَ عَٰقِبَتَهُمَآ أَنَّهُمَا فِى ٱلنَّارِ خَٰلِدَيْنِ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَٰٓؤُا۟ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
ayah_en: Thus, in the end, both will find themselves in the Fire, therein to abide: that is the reward of evil-doers.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلْتَنظُرْ نَفْسٌۭ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ لِغَدٍۢ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: Believers! Fear God, and let every soul look to what it lays up for the future. Fear God: God is aware of what you do.

ayah_ar: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ نَسُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَأَنسَىٰهُمْ أَنفُسَهُمْ ۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْفَٰسِقُونَ
ayah_en: Do not be like those who forgot God, so that He caused them to forget their own souls \[their own true interests\]. It is they who are the rebellious ones.

ayah_ar: لَا يَسْتَوِىٓ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۚ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ هُمُ ٱلْفَآئِزُونَ
ayah_en: The people of the Fire and the people of Paradise are not equal. The people of Paradise are the victorious ones.

ayah_ar: لَوْ أَنزَلْنَا هَٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ عَلَىٰ جَبَلٍۢ لَّرَأَيْتَهُۥ خَٰشِعًۭا مُّتَصَدِّعًۭا مِّنْ خَشْيَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَتِلْكَ ٱلْأَمْثَٰلُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
ayah_en: Had We sent down this Quran on a mountain, you would certainly have seen it falling down and splitting asunder, because of the fear of God. We set forth these parables to men so that they may reflect.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ عَٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَٰدَةِ ۖ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
ayah_en: He is God: there is no deity save Him. He knows the unseen and the visible. He is the Compassionate, the Merciful.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱلْقُدُّوسُ ٱلسَّلَٰمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُ ٱلْمُهَيْمِنُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْجَبَّارُ ٱلْمُتَكَبِّرُ ۚ سُبْحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
ayah_en: He is God, there is no deity save Him, the Sovereign, the Most Pure, the Source of Peace, the Granter of Security, the Protector, the Mighty, the Subduer, the Supreme, Glory be to God, who is far above what they associate with Him.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخَٰلِقُ ٱلْبَارِئُ ٱلْمُصَوِّرُ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْأَسْمَآءُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: He is God -- the Creator, the Originator, the Giver of Form. His are the most excellent names. Everything in the heavens and earth declares His glory. He is the Mighty, the Wise One.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ عَدُوِّى وَعَدُوَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءَ تُلْقُونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا۟ بِمَا جَآءَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْحَقِّ يُخْرِجُونَ ٱلرَّسُولَ وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۙ أَن تُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ رَبِّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ خَرَجْتُمْ جِهَٰدًۭا فِى سَبِيلِى وَٱبْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِى ۚ تُسِرُّونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَأَنَا۠ أَعْلَمُ بِمَآ أَخْفَيْتُمْ وَمَآ أَعْلَنتُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْهُ مِنكُمْ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ
ayah_en: Believers! Do not offer friendship to those who are enemies of Mine and of yours. Would you show them affection when they have rejected the truth you have received; when they have driven you and the Messenger out \[simply\] because you believe in God, your Lord. If you have left your homes to strive for My cause and out of a desire to seek My goodwill, how can you secretly offer them friendship? I know all that you conceal and all that you reveal. Whoever of you does this will surely stray from the right path.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: إِن يَثْقَفُوكُمْ يَكُونُوا۟ لَكُمْ أَعْدَآءًۭ وَيَبْسُطُوٓا۟ إِلَيْكُمْ أَيْدِيَهُمْ وَأَلْسِنَتَهُم بِٱلسُّوٓءِ وَوَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تَكْفُرُونَ
ayah_en: If they gain ascendancy over you, they will behave towards you as enemies and stretch out their hands as well as their tongues with evil intent; they long for you to renounce your faith.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: لَن تَنفَعَكُمْ أَرْحَامُكُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَٰدُكُمْ ۚ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Neither your relatives nor your children will be of any help to you on the Day of Resurrection. He will judge between you, and God sees all that you do.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌۭ فِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥٓ إِذْ قَالُوا۟ لِقَوْمِهِمْ إِنَّا بُرَءَٰٓؤُا۟ مِنكُمْ وَمِمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَفَرْنَا بِكُمْ وَبَدَا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْعَدَٰوَةُ وَٱلْبَغْضَآءُ أَبَدًا حَتَّىٰ تُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَحْدَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَوْلَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ لِأَبِيهِ لَأَسْتَغْفِرَنَّ لَكَ وَمَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ ۖ رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: Indeed you have an excellent example in Abraham and those who followed him, when they said to their people, "We disown you and whatever you worship besides God. We renounce you. Enmity and hatred shall endure between us and you, until you believe in the one God." \[The exception was\] when Abraham said to his father, "I shall indeed pray for \[God"s\] forgiveness for you; although I do not have it in my power to obtain anything from God on your behalf." They prayed, "O our Lord, in You we have placed our trust and to You we turn in repentance and to You is the final return.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا رَبَّنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: Our Lord, do not make us a prey for those who deny the truth, and forgive us our Lord. For You alone are the Mighty, the Wise One."

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: لَقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِيهِمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌۭ لِّمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلْءَاخِرَ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
ayah_en: Surely, there is a good example in them for you; for those who place their hopes in God and the Last Day. Whoever turns away will surely learn that God is self-sufficient and worthy of all praise.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: ۞ عَسَى ٱللَّهُ أَن يَجْعَلَ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَ ٱلَّذِينَ عَادَيْتُم مِّنْهُم مَّوَدَّةًۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ قَدِيرٌۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: It may well be that God will create goodwill between you and those of them with whom you are now at enmity -- for God is all powerful, most forgiving and merciful.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: لَّا يَنْهَىٰكُمُ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ لَمْ يُقَٰتِلُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَلَمْ يُخْرِجُوكُم مِّن دِيَٰرِكُمْ أَن تَبَرُّوهُمْ وَتُقْسِطُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُقْسِطِينَ
ayah_en: He does not forbid you to deal kindly and justly with anyone who has not fought you on account of your faith or driven you out of your homes: God loves the just.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: إِنَّمَا يَنْهَىٰكُمُ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ قَٰتَلُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَأَخْرَجُوكُم مِّن دِيَٰرِكُمْ وَظَٰهَرُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ إِخْرَاجِكُمْ أَن تَوَلَّوْهُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّهُمْ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ
ayah_en: God only forbids you to make friends with those who have fought against you on account of your faith and driven you out of your homes or helped others to do so. Any of you who turn towards them in friendship will truly be transgressors.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتُ مُهَٰجِرَٰتٍۢ فَٱمْتَحِنُوهُنَّ ۖ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِإِيمَٰنِهِنَّ ۖ فَإِنْ عَلِمْتُمُوهُنَّ مُؤْمِنَٰتٍۢ فَلَا تَرْجِعُوهُنَّ إِلَى ٱلْكُفَّارِ ۖ لَا هُنَّ حِلٌّۭ لَّهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحِلُّونَ لَهُنَّ ۖ وَءَاتُوهُم مَّآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ وَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَن تَنكِحُوهُنَّ إِذَآ ءَاتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۚ وَلَا تُمْسِكُوا۟ بِعِصَمِ ٱلْكَوَافِرِ وَسْـَٔلُوا۟ مَآ أَنفَقْتُمْ وَلْيَسْـَٔلُوا۟ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ حُكْمُ ٱللَّهِ ۖ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Believers! When believing women come to you as refugees, submit them to a test. Their faith is best known to God. Then if you find them to be true believers, do not send them back to those who deny the truth. These \[women\] are not lawful for them, nor are those who deny the truth lawful for these women. But hand back to those who deny the truth the dowers they gave them; nor is it an offence for you to marry such women, provided you give them their dowers. Do not maintain your marriages with those women who deny the truth: demand repayment of the dowers you have given them and let the disbelievers ask for the return of what they have spent. Such is God's judgement; He judges with justice between you. God is all knowing and all wise.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: وَإِن فَاتَكُمْ شَىْءٌۭ مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُمْ إِلَى ٱلْكُفَّارِ فَعَاقَبْتُمْ فَـَٔاتُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ذَهَبَتْ أَزْوَٰجُهُم مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنتُم بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنُونَ
ayah_en: If any of your wives desert you to go over to the disbelievers, and you subsequently have your turn, \[by the coming over of a woman from the other side\] give to those who have been deserted by their wives the equivalent of the dowers they gave them. Fear God in whom you believe.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِذَا جَآءَكَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتُ يُبَايِعْنَكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن لَّا يُشْرِكْنَ بِٱللَّهِ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا يَسْرِقْنَ وَلَا يَزْنِينَ وَلَا يَقْتُلْنَ أَوْلَٰدَهُنَّ وَلَا يَأْتِينَ بِبُهْتَٰنٍۢ يَفْتَرِينَهُۥ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِنَّ وَأَرْجُلِهِنَّ وَلَا يَعْصِينَكَ فِى مَعْرُوفٍۢ ۙ فَبَايِعْهُنَّ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُنَّ ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: O Prophet! When believing women come to you and pledge themselves not to associate in worship any other thing with God, not to steal or commit adultery or kill their children or indulge in slander, intentionally inventing falsehoods, and not to disobey you in that which is right, then accept their pledge of allegiance and pray to God to forgive them their sins, for God is forgiving and merciful.

surah_name_en: She that is to be examined
ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَوَلَّوْا۟ قَوْمًا غَضِبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ قَدْ يَئِسُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ كَمَا يَئِسَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مِنْ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْقُبُورِ
ayah_en: Believers! Do not make friends with those who have incurred the wrath of God. Such men are indeed bereft of all hope of a life to come, just as those who deny the truth lying in their graves are bereft of all hopes.

ayah_ar: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: Everything in the heavens and earth glorifies God -- He is the Almighty, the Wise.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لِمَ تَقُولُونَ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ
ayah_en: Believers! Why do you say one thing and do another.

ayah_ar: كَبُرَ مَقْتًا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ أَن تَقُولُوا۟ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ
ayah_en: It is most hateful to God that you do not practise what you preach;

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِهِۦ صَفًّۭا كَأَنَّهُم بُنْيَٰنٌۭ مَّرْصُوصٌۭ
ayah_en: surely, God loves those who fight for His cause in ranks, as if they were a solid cemented structure.

ayah_ar: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تُؤْذُونَنِى وَقَد تَّعْلَمُونَ أَنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا زَاغُوٓا۟ أَزَاغَ ٱللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْفَٰسِقِينَ
ayah_en: Remember when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you cause me grief when you know that I am God's Messenger to you?" When they wavered, God let their hearts waver too. God does not guide transgressors.

ayah_ar: وَإِذْ قَالَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ يَٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ إِنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُم مُّصَدِّقًۭا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَىَّ مِنَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَمُبَشِّرًۢا بِرَسُولٍۢ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِى ٱسْمُهُۥٓ أَحْمَدُ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَٰتِ قَالُوا۟ هَٰذَا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
ayah_en: Remember when Jesus, son of Mary, said, "O Children of Israel, I am sent to you by God, confirming the Torah that came before me and bringing good news of a messenger to follow me, whose name will be Ahmad." Yet when he came to them with clear signs, they said, "This is merely sorcery."

ayah_ar: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُوَ يُدْعَىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلْإِسْلَٰمِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
ayah_en: Who could be more wicked than one who invents lies about God when called to submit to Him? God does not guide the wrongdoers:

ayah_ar: يُرِيدُونَ لِيُطْفِـُٔوا۟ نُورَ ٱللَّهِ بِأَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَٱللَّهُ مُتِمُّ نُورِهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ
ayah_en: they wish to put His light out with their mouths. But He will perfect His light, much as those who deny the truth may dislike it;

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُۥ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ ٱلْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلدِّينِ كُلِّهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُشْرِكُونَ
ayah_en: it is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the true religion, so that He may cause it to prevail over all religions, however much the polytheists may dislike it.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ تِجَٰرَةٍۢ تُنجِيكُم مِّنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: Believers! Shall I guide you to a profitable course that will save you from a painful punishment?

ayah_ar: تُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَتُجَٰهِدُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ بِأَمْوَٰلِكُمْ وَأَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: You should believe in God and His Messenger, and strive for God's cause with your possessions and your lives. That will be better for you, if you only knew --

ayah_ar: يَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ وَيُدْخِلْكُمْ جَنَّٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ وَمَسَٰكِنَ طَيِّبَةًۭ فِى جَنَّٰتِ عَدْنٍۢ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
ayah_en: and He will forgive you your sins and admit you into Gardens with rivers flowing under them. He will lodge you in fine dwellings in the Gardens of Eternity; that is indeed the supreme achievement.

ayah_ar: وَأُخْرَىٰ تُحِبُّونَهَا ۖ نَصْرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَفَتْحٌۭ قَرِيبٌۭ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayah_en: He will give you another blessing which you desire: help from God and imminent victory. Give good tidings \[O Muhammad\] to believers!

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ كُونُوٓا۟ أَنصَارَ ٱللَّهِ كَمَا قَالَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ لِلْحَوَارِيِّۦنَ مَنْ أَنصَارِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ ٱلْحَوَارِيُّونَ نَحْنُ أَنصَارُ ٱللَّهِ ۖ فَـَٔامَنَت طَّآئِفَةٌۭ مِّنۢ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَكَفَرَت طَّآئِفَةٌۭ ۖ فَأَيَّدْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ عَلَىٰ عَدُوِّهِمْ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ ظَٰهِرِينَ
ayah_en: Believers, be God's helpers, as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who will be my helpers in the cause of God?" The disciples said, "We shall be God's helpers." Some of the Children of Israel believed in him and some denied the truth; We supported the believers against their enemies and they triumphed over them.

ayah_ar: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْمَلِكِ ٱلْقُدُّوسِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
ayah_en: Whatever is in the heavens and on the earth glorifies God, the Sovereign Lord, the Holy One, the Mighty, the Wise.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ فِى ٱلْأُمِّيِّۦنَ رَسُولًۭا مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَإِن كَانُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ لَفِى ضَلَٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
ayah_en: It is He who has raised among the unlettered people a messenger from among themselves who recites His revelations to them, and purifies them, and teaches them the Book and wisdom, for they had formerly been clearly misguided --

ayah_ar: وَءَاخَرِينَ مِنْهُمْ لَمَّا يَلْحَقُوا۟ بِهِمْ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: and to others also, from among them, who have not yet joined them. He is the Mighty, the Wise One.

ayah_ar: ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: That is God's grace; He bestows it on whom He pleases; for God is limitless in His grace.

ayah_ar: مَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ حُمِّلُوا۟ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَحْمِلُوهَا كَمَثَلِ ٱلْحِمَارِ يَحْمِلُ أَسْفَارًۢا ۚ بِئْسَ مَثَلُ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
ayah_en: Those who were charged with bearing the Torah, but did not do so are like an ass carrying a load of books. How unfortunate are those who belie the sign of God. God does not guide the wrongdoers.

ayah_ar: قُلْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوٓا۟ إِن زَعَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ لِلَّهِ مِن دُونِ ٱلنَّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا۟ ٱلْمَوْتَ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
ayah_en: Say, "You who are Jews, if you claim that you are favoured by God out of all people, then long for death, if you are truthful."

ayah_ar: وَلَا يَتَمَنَّوْنَهُۥٓ أَبَدًۢا بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
ayah_en: They will never wish for it, because of what their hands have sent forward. God has full knowledge of evil-doers.

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْمَوْتَ ٱلَّذِى تَفِرُّونَ مِنْهُ فَإِنَّهُۥ مُلَٰقِيكُمْ ۖ ثُمَّ تُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَٰدَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: So say, "The death you run away from will certainly meet you, and thereafter you will be brought back to the Knower of the unseen and the seen, and He will declare to you what you have done."

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا نُودِىَ لِلصَّلَوٰةِ مِن يَوْمِ ٱلْجُمُعَةِ فَٱسْعَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ وَذَرُوا۟ ٱلْبَيْعَ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: Believers! When the call to prayer is made on the day of congregation, hasten to the remembrance of God, and leave all worldly commerce: this is for your own good, if you but knew it.
