ayah_ar: فَإِذَا قُضِيَتِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةُ فَٱنتَشِرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
ayah_en: When the prayer is ended, disperse in the land and seek to obtain \[something\] of God's bounty; and remember God much, so that you may prosper.

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا۟ تِجَٰرَةً أَوْ لَهْوًا ٱنفَضُّوٓا۟ إِلَيْهَا وَتَرَكُوكَ قَآئِمًۭا ۚ قُلْ مَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهْوِ وَمِنَ ٱلتِّجَٰرَةِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
ayah_en: Yet when they see some merchandise or entertainment, they break away to go to it and leave you standing. Say, "That which God has in store is far better than any merchandise or entertainment." God is the most munificent Giver.

ayah_ar: إِذَا جَآءَكَ ٱلْمُنَٰفِقُونَ قَالُوا۟ نَشْهَدُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُهُۥ وَٱللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّ ٱلْمُنَٰفِقِينَ لَكَٰذِبُونَ
ayah_en: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of God." God knows that you are indeed His Messenger, but God bears witness that the hypocrites are surely liars --

ayah_ar: ٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ أَيْمَٰنَهُمْ جُنَّةًۭ فَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ سَآءَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: they use their oaths as a cover and thus they bar others from God's way: what they have been doing is truly evil --

ayah_ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ ءَامَنُوا۟ ثُمَّ كَفَرُوا۟ فَطُبِعَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ
ayah_en: that is because they believed and then rejected their faith: their hearts are sealed up, so that they are devoid of understanding.

ayah_ar: ۞ وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ تُعْجِبُكَ أَجْسَامُهُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَقُولُوا۟ تَسْمَعْ لِقَوْلِهِمْ ۖ كَأَنَّهُمْ خُشُبٌۭ مُّسَنَّدَةٌۭ ۖ يَحْسَبُونَ كُلَّ صَيْحَةٍ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ هُمُ ٱلْعَدُوُّ فَٱحْذَرْهُمْ ۚ قَٰتَلَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۖ أَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
ayah_en: When you see them, their outward appearance pleases you; when they speak, you listen to what they say. But they are like propped up blocks of timber. They think that every shout is directed against them. They are the \[real\] enemies, so beware of them. The curse of God be upon them! How they turn away!

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَعَالَوْا۟ يَسْتَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ لَوَّوْا۟ رُءُوسَهُمْ وَرَأَيْتَهُمْ يَصُدُّونَ وَهُم مُّسْتَكْبِرُونَ
ayah_en: When they are told, "Come! The Messenger of God will ask forgiveness for you!" they turn their heads away and you see them walking away arrogantly.

ayah_ar: سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَسْتَغْفَرْتَ لَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تَسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ لَن يَغْفِرَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْفَٰسِقِينَ
ayah_en: It makes no difference whether you ask forgiveness for them or not. God will not forgive them: God does not guide such rebellious people.

ayah_ar: هُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ لَا تُنفِقُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَنْ عِندَ رَسُولِ ٱللَّهِ حَتَّىٰ يَنفَضُّوا۟ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ خَزَآئِنُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱلْمُنَٰفِقِينَ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ
ayah_en: They are the ones who say, "Give nothing to those who follow God's Messenger, until they abandon him;" but the treasures of the heavens and the earth belong to God, though the hypocrites do not understand this

ayah_ar: يَقُولُونَ لَئِن رَّجَعْنَآ إِلَى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ لَيُخْرِجَنَّ ٱلْأَعَزُّ مِنْهَا ٱلْأَذَلَّ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْعِزَّةُ وَلِرَسُولِهِۦ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱلْمُنَٰفِقِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: \[and\] they say, "Indeed, when we return to Madinah, \[we\] the ones most worthy of honour, will surely drive out from there the contemptible ones!" \[referring to poor Muslims\]. However, all honour belongs to God, and to His Messenger and those who believe \[in God\]: but of this the hypocrites are not aware.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تُلْهِكُمْ أَمْوَٰلُكُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَٰدُكُمْ عَن ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَٰسِرُونَ
ayah_en: O believers! Do not let your wealth or your children distract you from remembrance of God. Those who do so will be the losers.

ayah_ar: وَأَنفِقُوا۟ مِن مَّا رَزَقْنَٰكُم مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِىَ أَحَدَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ فَيَقُولَ رَبِّ لَوْلَآ أَخَّرْتَنِىٓ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ قَرِيبٍۢ فَأَصَّدَّقَ وَأَكُن مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
ayah_en: And spend out of what We have provided you with before death comes to one of you and he says, "My Lord! If only You would grant me respite for a little while, then I would give alms and be among the righteous."

ayah_ar: وَلَن يُؤَخِّرَ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهَا ۚ وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: But God will not grant a reprieve to a soul when its appointed time has come; God is well-aware of what you do.

ayah_ar: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ ٱلْحَمْدُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌ
ayah_en: All that is in the heavens and on the earth extols the glory of God. To Him belongs the Kingdom and to Him all praise is due. He has power over all things.

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ فَمِنكُمْ كَافِرٌۭ وَمِنكُم مُّؤْمِنٌۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
ayah_en: It was He who created you; and some of you are those who deny this truth, and some who believe \[in it\]. God sees everything you do.

ayah_ar: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَصَوَّرَكُمْ فَأَحْسَنَ صُوَرَكُمْ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: He created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. He formed you and gave you the best of forms. To Him you shall all return.

ayah_ar: يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
ayah_en: He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He knows all that you conceal and all that you reveal. God is aware of what is in your hearts.

ayah_ar: أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَبَؤُا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ فَذَاقُوا۟ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Have you not heard about those who denied the truth before you and tasted the evil consequences of their conduct? They will have a painful punishment.

ayah_ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُۥ كَانَت تَّأْتِيهِمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَٰتِ فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرٌۭ يَهْدُونَنَا فَكَفَرُوا۟ وَتَوَلَّوا۟ ۚ وَّٱسْتَغْنَى ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌۭ
ayah_en: That was because their messengers came to them with clear signs, but they replied, "Shall mortals be our guides?" And so they rejected the truth and turned away. God has no need of such people; God is self-sufficient and worthy of all praise.

ayah_ar: زَعَمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن لَّن يُبْعَثُوا۟ ۚ قُلْ بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّى لَتُبْعَثُنَّ ثُمَّ لَتُنَبَّؤُنَّ بِمَا عَمِلْتُمْ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Those who deny the truth claim that they will never be raised up again. Say, "By my Lord, most surely you will be raised up again and then you will be told of all that you have done; and that is easy enough for God."

ayah_ar: فَـَٔامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَٱلنُّورِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلْنَا ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Believe then in God and His Messenger, and in the light which We have sent down. God is fully aware of all that you do.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يَجْمَعُكُمْ لِيَوْمِ ٱلْجَمْعِ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلتَّغَابُنِ ۗ وَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَٰلِحًۭا يُكَفِّرْ عَنْهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِۦ وَيُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
ayah_en: When He shall gather you all for the Day of Gathering, that will be the Day of loss and gain; and whoever believes in God and does good deeds shall be forgiven their sins and admitted to Gardens through which rivers flow, where they shall dwell forever. That is the supreme triumph.

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: But those who denied the truth and rejected Our signs shall be the inmates of the Fire, there to remain -- what an evil destination!

ayah_ar: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ يَهْدِ قَلْبَهُۥ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: No affliction can befall man but by God's permission -- He guides the hearts of those who believe in Him: God has knowledge of all things --

ayah_ar: وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱلرَّسُولَ ۚ فَإِن تَوَلَّيْتُمْ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَىٰ رَسُولِنَا ٱلْبَلَٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
ayah_en: obey God and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away, remember that Our Messenger is only responsible for clearly conveying the message.

ayah_ar: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
ayah_en: God! There is no god but He, so let the faithful put their trust in Him.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُمْ وَأَوْلَٰدِكُمْ عَدُوًّۭا لَّكُمْ فَٱحْذَرُوهُمْ ۚ وَإِن تَعْفُوا۟ وَتَصْفَحُوا۟ وَتَغْفِرُوا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌ
ayah_en: Believers! \[Even\] among your wives and your children you have enemies: so beware of them. But if you overlook their offences and forgive and pardon them, then surely, God is most forgiving and merciful.

ayah_ar: إِنَّمَآ أَمْوَٰلُكُمْ وَأَوْلَٰدُكُمْ فِتْنَةٌۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عِندَهُۥٓ أَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Your wealth and your children are only a trial; God's reward is great:

ayah_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا ٱسْتَطَعْتُمْ وَٱسْمَعُوا۟ وَأَطِيعُوا۟ وَأَنفِقُوا۟ خَيْرًۭا لِّأَنفُسِكُمْ ۗ وَمَن يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفْسِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
ayah_en: so be mindful of God as best as you can; and listen, and obey; and spend in charity: it is for your own good. Those who guard themselves against their own greed will surely prosper:

ayah_ar: إِن تُقْرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًۭا يُضَٰعِفْهُ لَكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ شَكُورٌ حَلِيمٌ
ayah_en: if you give a good loan to God, He will multiply it for you and forgive you, for God is appreciative and forbearing;

ayah_ar: عَٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَٰدَةِ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: God is the Knower of the unseen and the seen: He is the Almighty, the Wise One.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ ٱلنِّسَآءَ فَطَلِّقُوهُنَّ لِعِدَّتِهِنَّ وَأَحْصُوا۟ ٱلْعِدَّةَ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ ۖ لَا تُخْرِجُوهُنَّ مِنۢ بُيُوتِهِنَّ وَلَا يَخْرُجْنَ إِلَّآ أَن يَأْتِينَ بِفَٰحِشَةٍۢ مُّبَيِّنَةٍۢ ۚ وَتِلْكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَعَدَّ حُدُودَ ٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ نَفْسَهُۥ ۚ لَا تَدْرِى لَعَلَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحْدِثُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ أَمْرًۭا
ayah_en: O Prophet! When any of you divorce your wives, divorce them during their period of purity and calculate the period carefully: be mindful of God, your Lord. Do not drive them out of their homes, nor should they themselves leave, unless they become openly guilty of immoral conduct. These are the bounds set by God. He who transgresses God's bounds wrongs his own soul. You never know, after that, God may well bring about some new situation.

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا بَلَغْنَ أَجَلَهُنَّ فَأَمْسِكُوهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوفٍ أَوْ فَارِقُوهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوفٍۢ وَأَشْهِدُوا۟ ذَوَىْ عَدْلٍۢ مِّنكُمْ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَٰدَةَ لِلَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ يُوعَظُ بِهِۦ مَن كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْءَاخِرِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجًۭا
ayah_en: And when their waiting term is ended, either keep them honourably or part with them in honour. Call to witness two reliable men from among you and bear true witness for God. This is an admonishment for those who believe in God and the Last Day. To one who fears God, He will grant a way out \[of his difficulties\],

ayah_ar: وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَٰلِغُ أَمْرِهِۦ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدْرًۭا
ayah_en: and God will provide for him from an unexpected source; God suffices for anyone who puts his trust in Him. God will surely bring about what He decrees. He has set a measure for all things.

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّٰٓـِٔى يَئِسْنَ مِنَ ٱلْمَحِيضِ مِن نِّسَآئِكُمْ إِنِ ٱرْتَبْتُمْ فَعِدَّتُهُنَّ ثَلَٰثَةُ أَشْهُرٍۢ وَٱلَّٰٓـِٔى لَمْ يَحِضْنَ ۚ وَأُو۟لَٰتُ ٱلْأَحْمَالِ أَجَلُهُنَّ أَن يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِهِۦ يُسْرًۭا
ayah_en: In the case of those of your wives who have passed the age of menstruation, if you have any doubt, know that their waiting period is three months; and that will apply likewise to those who have not yet menstruated; the waiting period of those who are pregnant will be until they deliver their burden \[give birth\]. God makes things easy for those who are mindful of Him.

ayah_ar: ذَٰلِكَ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ أَنزَلَهُۥٓ إِلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يُكَفِّرْ عَنْهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِۦ وَيُعْظِمْ لَهُۥٓ أَجْرًا
ayah_en: Such is the commandment which God has revealed to you. He who fears God shall be forgiven his sins and richly rewarded.

ayah_ar: أَسْكِنُوهُنَّ مِنْ حَيْثُ سَكَنتُم مِّن وُجْدِكُمْ وَلَا تُضَآرُّوهُنَّ لِتُضَيِّقُوا۟ عَلَيْهِنَّ ۚ وَإِن كُنَّ أُو۟لَٰتِ حَمْلٍۢ فَأَنفِقُوا۟ عَلَيْهِنَّ حَتَّىٰ يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ ۚ فَإِنْ أَرْضَعْنَ لَكُمْ فَـَٔاتُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۖ وَأْتَمِرُوا۟ بَيْنَكُم بِمَعْرُوفٍۢ ۖ وَإِن تَعَاسَرْتُمْ فَسَتُرْضِعُ لَهُۥٓ أُخْرَىٰ
ayah_en: Let the women \[who are undergoing a waiting period\] live in the same manner as you live yourselves, in accordance with your means; and do not harass them in order to make their lives difficult. If they are pregnant, maintain them until they give birth; if they suckle your infants, pay them for it; discuss things among yourselves in all decency -- if you cannot bear with each other, let another woman suckle for you --

ayah_ar: لِيُنفِقْ ذُو سَعَةٍۢ مِّن سَعَتِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن قُدِرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقُهُۥ فَلْيُنفِقْ مِمَّآ ءَاتَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا مَآ ءَاتَىٰهَا ۚ سَيَجْعَلُ ٱللَّهُ بَعْدَ عُسْرٍۢ يُسْرًۭا
ayah_en: let the man of means spend in accordance with his means; and let him whose resources are restricted, spend in accordance with what God has given him. God does not burden any person with more than He has given him. God will soon bring about ease after hardship.

ayah_ar: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ عَتَتْ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهَا وَرُسُلِهِۦ فَحَاسَبْنَٰهَا حِسَابًۭا شَدِيدًۭا وَعَذَّبْنَٰهَا عَذَابًۭا نُّكْرًۭا
ayah_en: How many a town rebelled against the commands of its Lord and His messengers and We called them sternly to account and punished them severely,

ayah_ar: فَذَاقَتْ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهَا وَكَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ أَمْرِهَا خُسْرًا
ayah_en: so they tasted the evil consequences of their conduct and the result of their conduct was ruin.

ayah_ar: أَعَدَّ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًۭا شَدِيدًۭا ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ يَٰٓأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَٰبِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ قَدْ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَيْكُمْ ذِكْرًۭا
ayah_en: God has prepared a severe punishment for them. So, fear God, O men of understanding, who have believed. God has sent down to you a Reminder

ayah_ar: رَّسُولًۭا يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ ءَايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ مُبَيِّنَٰتٍۢ لِّيُخْرِجَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ مِنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ ۚ وَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَٰلِحًۭا يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًۭا ۖ قَدْ أَحْسَنَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُۥ رِزْقًا
ayah_en: and a messenger who conveys to you God's clear messages, so that he might lead those, who believe and do good deeds, out of darkness into light. God will admit those who believe in Him and do good deeds into Gardens with rivers flowing through them, where they will remain forever. God has indeed made excellent provision for them.

ayah_ar: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٍۢ وَمِنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ مِثْلَهُنَّ يَتَنَزَّلُ ٱلْأَمْرُ بَيْنَهُنَّ لِتَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَاطَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عِلْمًۢا
ayah_en: It is God who created the seven heavens and the same number of earths. His commandment descends among them, so that you may know that God has power over all things; and that He encompasses all things with His knowledge.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ مَآ أَحَلَّ ٱللَّهُ لَكَ ۖ تَبْتَغِى مَرْضَاتَ أَزْوَٰجِكَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: Prophet, why in your desire to please your wives, do you impose a ban on what God has made lawful to you? God is forgiving and merciful.

ayah_ar: قَدْ فَرَضَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ تَحِلَّةَ أَيْمَٰنِكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayah_en: God has already ordained that you be absolved of such oaths. God is your patron. He is the All Knowing, the Wise One.

ayah_ar: وَإِذْ أَسَرَّ ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِلَىٰ بَعْضِ أَزْوَٰجِهِۦ حَدِيثًۭا فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَتْ بِهِۦ وَأَظْهَرَهُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ عَرَّفَ بَعْضَهُۥ وَأَعْرَضَ عَنۢ بَعْضٍۢ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَهَا بِهِۦ قَالَتْ مَنْ أَنۢبَأَكَ هَٰذَا ۖ قَالَ نَبَّأَنِىَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
ayah_en: The Prophet once told one of his wives something in confidence. She did not keep it secret and God informed him of this; he made known a part of it, and avoided \[mentioning\] part of it. When he spoke to his wife of this, she asked him who had told him about it. He replied, "The All Knowing, the All Aware One."

ayah_ar: إِن تَتُوبَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ صَغَتْ قُلُوبُكُمَا ۖ وَإِن تَظَٰهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَىٰهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَٰلِحُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ
ayah_en: If only both of you would turn to God in repentance -- and your hearts are already so inclined. But if you uphold each other against him, then surely God is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous among the believers; and the angels too are his helpers.

ayah_ar: عَسَىٰ رَبُّهُۥٓ إِن طَلَّقَكُنَّ أَن يُبْدِلَهُۥٓ أَزْوَٰجًا خَيْرًۭا مِّنكُنَّ مُسْلِمَٰتٍۢ مُّؤْمِنَٰتٍۢ قَٰنِتَٰتٍۢ تَٰٓئِبَٰتٍ عَٰبِدَٰتٍۢ سَٰٓئِحَٰتٍۢ ثَيِّبَٰتٍۢ وَأَبْكَارًۭا
ayah_en: Were he to divorce you, his Lord might well replace you with better wives -- submissive \[to God\], believing, pious, penitent, devout in worship, given to fasting -- previously married and virgins.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ قُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَأَهْلِيكُمْ نَارًۭا وَقُودُهَا ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلْحِجَارَةُ عَلَيْهَا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٌ غِلَاظٌۭ شِدَادٌۭ لَّا يَعْصُونَ ٱللَّهَ مَآ أَمَرَهُمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ
ayah_en: Believers, safeguard yourselves and your families from a Fire fuelled by people and stones, and watched over by angels, stern and strong: angels who never disobey God's commands to them, but promptly do as they are commanded.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَا تَعْتَذِرُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayah_en: You who are bent on denying the truth, make no excuses today: you are only being rewarded according to your deeds.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ تُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوْبَةًۭ نَّصُوحًا عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يُكَفِّرَ عَنكُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِكُمْ وَيُدْخِلَكُمْ جَنَّٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ يَوْمَ لَا يُخْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلنَّبِىَّ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ ۖ نُورُهُمْ يَسْعَىٰ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَٰنِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Believers, turn to God in sincere repentance. Your Lord may well forgive your bad deeds and admit you into gardens watered by running streams, on a Day when God will not abase the Prophet and those who have believed with him. Their light will shine out ahead of them and on their right, and they will say: "Lord perfect our light for us, and forgive us; You have power over all things."

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ جَٰهِدِ ٱلْكُفَّارَ وَٱلْمُنَٰفِقِينَ وَٱغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: Prophet, exert yourself to the utmost against those who deny the truth and the hypocrites. Deal severely with them. Hell will be their abode -- a vile destination.

ayah_ar: ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱمْرَأَتَ نُوحٍۢ وَٱمْرَأَتَ لُوطٍۢ ۖ كَانَتَا تَحْتَ عَبْدَيْنِ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا صَٰلِحَيْنِ فَخَانَتَاهُمَا فَلَمْ يُغْنِيَا عَنْهُمَا مِنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًۭٔا وَقِيلَ ٱدْخُلَا ٱلنَّارَ مَعَ ٱلدَّٰخِلِينَ
ayah_en: As an example to those who are bent on denying the truth, God cited the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot, who were married to two of Our righteous servants, but who betrayed them. So they could not help them against God, and they were told, "Enter the Fire along with all the others."

ayah_ar: وَضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱمْرَأَتَ فِرْعَوْنَ إِذْ قَالَتْ رَبِّ ٱبْنِ لِى عِندَكَ بَيْتًۭا فِى ٱلْجَنَّةِ وَنَجِّنِى مِن فِرْعَوْنَ وَعَمَلِهِۦ وَنَجِّنِى مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
ayah_en: To the believers God has given the example of Pharaoh's wife who said: "My Lord, build me a house in nearness to You in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his misdeeds. Save me from all evil-doers."

ayah_ar: وَمَرْيَمَ ٱبْنَتَ عِمْرَٰنَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِنَا وَصَدَّقَتْ بِكَلِمَٰتِ رَبِّهَا وَكُتُبِهِۦ وَكَانَتْ مِنَ ٱلْقَٰنِتِينَ
ayah_en: \[God gave another example in the story of\] Mary, 'Imran's daughter, who preserved her chastity and We breathed Our spirit into her; she testified to the words of her Lord and His Scriptures, and was truly devout.

ayah_ar: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱلَّذِى بِيَدِهِ ٱلْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌ
ayah_en: Blessed is He in whose hand is the Kingdom: He has power over all things;

ayah_ar: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْمَوْتَ وَٱلْحَيَوٰةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًۭا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْغَفُورُ
ayah_en: He created death and life so that He might test you, and find out which of you is best in conduct. He is the Mighty, the Most Forgiving One.

ayah_ar: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٍۢ طِبَاقًۭا ۖ مَّا تَرَىٰ فِى خَلْقِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ مِن تَفَٰوُتٍۢ ۖ فَٱرْجِعِ ٱلْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِن فُطُورٍۢ
ayah_en: He created seven heavens one above the other in layers. You will not find any flaw in the creation of the Gracious One. Then look once again: can you see any flaw?

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ ٱرْجِعِ ٱلْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًۭا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: Then look again and again. Your gaze will come back to you confused and exhausted.

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِمَصَٰبِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَٰهَا رُجُومًۭا لِّلشَّيَٰطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
ayah_en: We have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps, and We have made them for driving away devils. For them We have prepared the punishment of the blazing Fire.

ayah_ar: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
ayah_en: Those who are bent on blaspheming against their Lord will have the punishment of Hell: an evil destination.

ayah_ar: إِذَآ أُلْقُوا۟ فِيهَا سَمِعُوا۟ لَهَا شَهِيقًۭا وَهِىَ تَفُورُ
ayah_en: When they are cast into it, they will hear its roaring as it boils up,

ayah_ar: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَآ أُلْقِىَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌۭ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: as though bursting with rage. Each time a group is cast into it, its keepers will ask them, "Did no warner come to you?"

ayah_ar: قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَآءَنَا نَذِيرٌۭ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَٰلٍۢ كَبِيرٍۢ
ayah_en: They will say, "Of course, a warner did come to us, but we belied him and we said, 'God has revealed nothing; you are in gross error.'"

ayah_ar: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِىٓ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
ayah_en: They will say, "If we had only listened or understood, we should not now be among the inmates of Hell,"

ayah_ar: فَٱعْتَرَفُوا۟ بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًۭا لِّأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
ayah_en: and thus they will confess their sin; far from God's mercy are the inmates of Hell.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَيْبِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌۭ وَأَجْرٌۭ كَبِيرٌۭ
ayah_en: As for those who fear their Lord in the unseen will have forgiveness and a rich reward.

ayah_ar: وَأَسِرُّوا۟ قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ ٱجْهَرُوا۟ بِهِۦٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
ayah_en: Whether you speak in secret or aloud, He knows what is in every heart.

ayah_ar: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
ayah_en: How could He who created not know His own creation, when He alone is the Most Subtle in His wisdom and the All Aware?

ayah_ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًۭا فَٱمْشُوا۟ فِى مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِهِۦ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ
ayah_en: It is He who has made the earth subservient to you, so traverse its regions and eat its provisions. To Him you shall all be resurrected.

ayah_ar: ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَمُورُ
ayah_en: Do you feel secure that He who is in heaven will not cause the earth to sink beneath you and then begin to quake?

ayah_ar: أَمْ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًۭا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
ayah_en: Do you feel secure that the One in heaven will not send against you a whirlwind to pelt you with stones, so that you will know how \[true\] My warning was?

ayah_ar: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
ayah_en: Those who went before them belied \[the truth\]: then how great was My rejection of them.

ayah_ar: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَٰٓفَّٰتٍۢ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍۭ بَصِيرٌ
ayah_en: Do they not see the birds above them spreading and closing their wings? None save the Merciful sustains them. Surely, He observes all things.

ayah_ar: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ جُندٌۭ لَّكُمْ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ إِنِ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِى غُرُورٍ
ayah_en: Who is there to defend you like an army, besides the Lord of Mercy? Those who deny the truth are in deception.

ayah_ar: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُۥ ۚ بَل لَّجُّوا۟ فِى عُتُوٍّۢ وَنُفُورٍ
ayah_en: Who can provide for you, if He withholds His provision? Yet they obstinately persist in rebellion and avoidance of the truth.

ayah_ar: أَفَمَن يَمْشِى مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦٓ أَهْدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمْشِى سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: Is he who walks grovelling upon his face better guided, or he who walks upright upon a straight path?

ayah_ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
ayah_en: Say, "It is He who brought you into being, and made ears and eyes and hearts for you, yet you are seldom grateful."

ayah_ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
ayah_en: Say, "It is He who has scattered you on the earth; and it is to Him that you shall all be gathered \[on the Day of Resurrection\].

ayah_ar: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
ayah_en: They ask, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْعِلْمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
ayah_en: Say, "God alone has knowledge of that; and I am only a plain warner."

ayah_ar: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةًۭ سِيٓـَٔتْ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ
ayah_en: But when they see it drawing near, the faces of those who deny the truth will turn gloomy and they will be told, "This is what you were calling for."

ayah_ar: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِىَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِىَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: Say, "Have you thought: if God destroys me and those who are with me, or treats us mercifully, then who will protect those who deny the truth from a painful chastisement?"

ayah_ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
ayah_en: Say, "He is the Most Gracious: we believe in Him and we put our trust in Him. You will soon come to know who is in evident error."

ayah_ar: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَآؤُكُمْ غَوْرًۭا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَآءٍۢ مَّعِينٍۭ
ayah_en: Say, "Have you considered if your water were to sink into the ground, who could then bring you flowing water?"

ayah_ar: نٓ ۚ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
ayah_en: Nun. By the pen, and all that they write!

ayah_ar: مَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍۢ
ayah_en: By the grace of your Lord, you are not a mad man.

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍۢ
ayah_en: Most surely, you will have a never ending reward.

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: For you are truly of a sublime character.

ayah_ar: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ
ayah_en: Soon you will see, as will they,

ayah_ar: بِأَييِّكُمُ ٱلْمَفْتُونُ
ayah_en: which of you is a prey to madness.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
ayah_en: Your Lord knows best who has fallen by the wayside, and who has remained on the true path.

ayah_ar: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
ayah_en: Do not give in to the deniers of truth.

ayah_ar: وَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ
ayah_en: They want you to make concessions to them and then they will reciprocate.

ayah_ar: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍۢ مَّهِينٍ
ayah_en: Do not yield to any contemptible swearer of oaths,

ayah_ar: هَمَّازٍۢ مَّشَّآءٍۭ بِنَمِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: or to any defamer or one who spreads slander,

ayah_ar: مَّنَّاعٍۢ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
ayah_en: or to one who places obstacles in the way of good being done or to the wicked transgressor,

ayah_ar: عُتُلٍّۭ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ
ayah_en: who is ignoble and besides all that, base-born;

ayah_ar: أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍۢ وَبَنِينَ
ayah_en: just because he has wealth and sons,

ayah_ar: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayah_en: when Our revelations are recited to him, he says, "These are just ancient fables."

ayah_ar: سَنَسِمُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْخُرْطُومِ
ayah_en: Soon We will brand him on the nose.

ayah_ar: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
ayah_en: We have tried them as we tried the owners of a certain orchard, who vowed to harvest all its fruits the next morning,

ayah_ar: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ
ayah_en: without saying, "If it be God's will."

ayah_ar: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
ayah_en: A calamity from your Lord befell the orchard as they slept.

ayah_ar: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَٱلصَّرِيمِ
ayah_en: And by morning it lay as if it had already been harvested, a barren land.

ayah_ar: فَتَنَادَوْا۟ مُصْبِحِينَ
ayah_en: So they called out to each other at the break of dawn,

ayah_ar: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰرِمِينَ
ayah_en: saying, "Be quick to reach your orchard, if you want to gather all your fruits."

ayah_ar: فَٱنطَلَقُوا۟ وَهُمْ يَتَخَٰفَتُونَ
ayah_en: So they went off, whispering to one another,

ayah_ar: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌۭ
ayah_en: "Be sure to stop any poor person from entering the orchard today."

ayah_ar: وَغَدَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍۢ قَٰدِرِينَ
ayah_en: They set out early in the morning, thinking they had the power to prevent.

ayah_ar: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا لَضَآلُّونَ
ayah_en: But when they saw it, they said, "We must have lost our way.

ayah_ar: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
ayah_en: Indeed, we are utterly ruined!"

ayah_ar: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
ayah_en: The more upright of the two said, "Did I not bid you to glorify God?"

ayah_ar: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
ayah_en: They said, "Glory be to God, our Lord. We have surely done wrong."

ayah_ar: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ يَتَلَٰوَمُونَ
ayah_en: Then they began to heap reproaches on each other.

ayah_ar: قَالُوا۟ يَٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا طَٰغِينَ
ayah_en: They said, "Alas for us, our behaviour was beyond the pale.

ayah_ar: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
ayah_en: May be our Lord will give us a better orchard in its stead; we turn to Him."

ayah_ar: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: Such was their punishment, \[in this life\]. But the punishment of the life to come is much more severe, if only they knew it!

ayah_ar: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayah_en: Those who are mindful of their Lord will be rewarded with gardens of bliss.

ayah_ar: أَفَنَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ كَٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
ayah_en: Should We treat the true believers and the wrongdoers alike?

ayah_ar: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
ayah_en: What ails you? How ill you judge!

ayah_ar: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَٰبٌۭ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ
ayah_en: Have you a Scripture that tells you

ayah_ar: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ
ayah_en: that you will be granted whatever you choose?

ayah_ar: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
ayah_en: Or do you have Our solemn oaths, binding upon Us till the Day of Resurrection, that you shall have whatever you yourselves decide?

ayah_ar: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ
ayah_en: Ask them, which of them will vouch for that!

ayah_ar: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَٰدِقِينَ
ayah_en: Or have they other partners \[besides God\]? Let them bring forth their other partners, if what they say be true.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍۢ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
ayah_en: On the Day when the truth shall be laid bare, they will be called upon to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able to do so.

ayah_ar: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌۭ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَٰلِمُونَ
ayah_en: Their eyes will be cast down and they will be covered in shame; they were bidden to prostrate themselves, when they were safe and sound \[but they did not obey\].

ayah_ar: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: So leave to Me those who reject this message. We shall lead them step by step to their ruin, in ways beyond their ken.

ayah_ar: وَأُمْلِى لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِى مَتِينٌ
ayah_en: I shall grant them some respite, for My plan is powerful.

ayah_ar: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًۭا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍۢ مُّثْقَلُونَ
ayah_en: Do you demand some recompense from them that would weigh them down with debt?

ayah_ar: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
ayah_en: Is the unseen within their grasp so that they write it down?

ayah_ar: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌۭ
ayah_en: Wait patiently for your Lord's judgement; do not be like the man who, having been swallowed by a whale, called out in distress.

ayah_ar: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌۭ
ayah_en: Had his Lord's grace not been bestowed upon him, he would have been cast away in disgrace upon that desolate shore.

ayah_ar: فَٱجْتَبَٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
ayah_en: But his Lord chose him for His own and made him one of the righteous.

ayah_ar: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌۭ
ayah_en: When those who deny the truth hear the admonition, they would almost cause you to stumble with their evil eyes; and they say, "He is certainly mad."

ayah_ar: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌۭ لِّلْعَٰلَمِينَ
ayah_en: Yet it is purely an admonition to mankind.

ayah_ar: ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
ayah_en: The Inevitable Hour!

ayah_ar: مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
ayah_en: What is the Inevitable Hour?

ayah_ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
ayah_en: And what will make you realize what the Inevitable Hour is?

ayah_ar: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌۢ بِٱلْقَارِعَةِ
ayah_en: The tribes of Thamud and 'Ad denied that disaster would strike them:

ayah_ar: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ
ayah_en: the Thamud were destroyed by a terrible storm of thunder and lightning;

ayah_ar: وَأَمَّا عَادٌۭ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍۢ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍۢ
ayah_en: and the 'Ad were destroyed by a furious wind

ayah_ar: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍۢ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًۭا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍۢ
ayah_en: which God let loose against them for seven nights and eight days unremittingly, so that you could have seen its people lying prostrate as though they were the hollow trunks of palm-trees which had fallen down.

ayah_ar: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٍۢ
ayah_en: Do you see any vestige left of them now?

ayah_ar: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
ayah_en: Pharoah and those before him and the inhabitants of the overthrown cities persistently committed grave sins.

ayah_ar: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةًۭ رَّابِيَةً
ayah_en: They defied their Lord's messenger, so He seized them with an ever-tightening grip.

ayah_ar: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
ayah_en: But We bore you away in the Ark, when the waters rose high,

ayah_ar: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةًۭ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌۭ وَٰعِيَةٌۭ
ayah_en: so that We might make it a reminder for you and so that attentive ears might retain it.

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌۭ وَٰحِدَةٌۭ
ayah_en: When a single blast is blown on the trumpet,

ayah_ar: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ
ayah_en: and the earth and the mountains are lifted up and then crushed with a single blow,

ayah_ar: فَيَوْمَئِذٍۢ وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ
ayah_en: on that Day the Great Event will come to pass.

ayah_ar: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِىَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ وَاهِيَةٌۭ
ayah_en: And the sky will be rent asunder, for on that Day it will be so frail.

ayah_ar: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ ثَمَٰنِيَةٌۭ
ayah_en: The angels will appear by its sides and, on that Day, eight \[angels\] will bear your Lord's throne above them.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَئِذٍۢ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌۭ
ayah_en: On that Day you will be brought to judgement and none of your secrets will remain hidden.

ayah_ar: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَٰبِيَهْ
ayah_en: Then he who is given his record in his right hand will exclaim, "Here is my record, read it.

ayah_ar: إِنِّى ظَنَنتُ أَنِّى مُلَٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ
ayah_en: Surely, I knew that I should meet my reckoning,"

ayah_ar: فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍۢ رَّاضِيَةٍۢ
ayah_en: so he will live in a state of Bliss

ayah_ar: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍۢ
ayah_en: in a lofty garden,

ayah_ar: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌۭ
ayah_en: with clusters of fruit within easy reach.

ayah_ar: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
ayah_en: We shall say to him, "Eat and drink joyfully as a reward for the good deeds you did in days gone by."

ayah_ar: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهْ
ayah_en: But he who is given his record in his left hand will say, "If only I had never been given my Record

ayah_ar: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ
ayah_en: and knew nothing of my reckoning.

ayah_ar: يَٰلَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلْقَاضِيَةَ
ayah_en: How I wish my death had ended all.

ayah_ar: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّى مَالِيَهْ ۜ
ayah_en: My wealth has been of no use to me.

ayah_ar: هَلَكَ عَنِّى سُلْطَٰنِيَهْ
ayah_en: I am bereft of power."

ayah_ar: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ
ayah_en: Seize him and fetter him,

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ
ayah_en: and then let him enter Hell.

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍۢ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًۭا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
ayah_en: Then fasten him with a chain seventy cubits long:

ayah_ar: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: for he did not believe in Almighty God,

ayah_ar: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
ayah_en: nor did he feel any urge to feed the needy,

ayah_ar: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ ٱلْيَوْمَ هَٰهُنَا حَمِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: so today he has no friend here,

ayah_ar: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍۢ
ayah_en: and the only food he has is filth

ayah_ar: لَّا يَأْكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْخَٰطِـُٔونَ
ayah_en: which no one will eat except the sinners.

ayah_ar: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ
ayah_en: But nay, I swear by all that you can see

ayah_ar: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
ayah_en: as well as all that you cannot see:

ayah_ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍۢ كَرِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: most surely, this is the word brought by a noble messenger,

ayah_ar: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍۢ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
ayah_en: it is not the word of a poet -- how little you believe! --

ayah_ar: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍۢ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayah_en: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer -- how little you reflect!

ayah_ar: تَنزِيلٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
ayah_en: It is a revelation sent down by the Sustainer of the Universe:

ayah_ar: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ ٱلْأَقَاوِيلِ
ayah_en: if he had invented any lies about Us,

ayah_ar: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِٱلْيَمِينِ
ayah_en: We would indeed have seized him by his right hand

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ ٱلْوَتِينَ
ayah_en: and would indeed have cut his life-vein,

ayah_ar: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَٰجِزِينَ
ayah_en: and none of you could have held Us off from him.

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذْكِرَةٌۭ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
ayah_en: And surely it is an admonition to the God-fearing.

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ
ayah_en: We know very well that there are some among you who reject Our signs --

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
ayah_en: it will be a source of bitter regret for those who deny the truth --

ayah_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلْيَقِينِ
ayah_en: it is the indubitable truth.

ayah_ar: فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayah_en: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Almighty.

ayah_ar: سَأَلَ سَآئِلٌۢ بِعَذَابٍۢ وَاقِعٍۢ
ayah_en: A doubter once demanded that punishment be immediately meted out,

ayah_ar: لِّلْكَٰفِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٌۭ
ayah_en: to those who deny the truth. No power can hinder God

ayah_ar: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِى ٱلْمَعَارِجِ
ayah_en: from punishing them. He is the Lord of the Ascending Stairways,

ayah_ar: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍۢ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍۢ
ayah_en: by which the angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him in one Day which will last for fifty thousand years.

ayah_ar: فَٱصْبِرْ صَبْرًۭا جَمِيلًا
ayah_en: Therefore, \[O believers\] behave with seemly patience.

ayah_ar: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُۥ بَعِيدًۭا
ayah_en: They see it \[the Day of Judgement\] to be far off,

ayah_ar: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبًۭا
ayah_en: but We see it near at hand.

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلْمُهْلِ
ayah_en: On that Day the heavens shall become like molten brass,

ayah_ar: وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ
ayah_en: and the mountains will become like tufts of wool,

ayah_ar: وَلَا يَسْـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًۭا
ayah_en: and no friend will ask about his friend,

ayah_ar: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
ayah_en: though they shall be within sight of each other. The guilty one will gladly ransom himself from the torment of that Day by sacrificing his own children,

ayah_ar: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِيهِ
ayah_en: his wife, his brother,

ayah_ar: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِى تُـْٔوِيهِ
ayah_en: and his kinsfolk who gave him shelter,

ayah_ar: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًۭا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
ayah_en: and all the people of the earth, if that could deliver him.

ayah_ar: كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
ayah_en: But no! There is a raging blaze

ayah_ar: نَزَّاعَةًۭ لِّلشَّوَىٰ
ayah_en: stripping away his skin,

ayah_ar: تَدْعُوا۟ مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
ayah_en: and it will claim all those who turned their backs \[on the true faith\] and turned away \[from the truth\],

ayah_ar: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰٓ
ayah_en: and amassed wealth and hoarded it.

ayah_ar: ۞ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا
ayah_en: Indeed, man is born impatient:

ayah_ar: إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعًۭا
ayah_en: when misfortune touches him he starts lamenting,

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا
ayah_en: and whenever good fortune comes to him, he grows niggardly.

ayah_ar: إِلَّا ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ
ayah_en: But not so the worshippers

ayah_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَآئِمُونَ
ayah_en: who are steadfast in prayer;

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ فِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّۭ مَّعْلُومٌۭ
ayah_en: those who give a due share of their wealth

ayah_ar: لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ
ayah_en: to those who ask \[for help\] and to the destitute;

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
ayah_en: and those who believe in the Day of Judgement

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
ayah_en: and are fearful of the punishment of their Lord;

ayah_ar: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍۢ
ayah_en: for none may ever feel secure from the punishment of their Lord;

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَٰفِظُونَ
ayah_en: those who preserve their chastity

ayah_ar: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
ayah_en: except from their spouses and those whom they rightfully possess \[through wedlock\], for which they incur no blame --

ayah_ar: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
ayah_en: but those who go beyond that limit are transgressors;

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَٰنَٰتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَٰعُونَ
ayah_en: and those who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges;

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَٰدَٰتِهِمْ قَآئِمُونَ
ayah_en: and those who stand by their testimony

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
ayah_en: and are steadfast in their prayers.

ayah_ar: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ فِى جَنَّٰتٍۢ مُّكْرَمُونَ
ayah_en: They will be honoured in the Gardens of Bliss.

ayah_ar: فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ
ayah_en: But what is the matter with those who deny the truth, that they come hastening towards you

ayah_ar: عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
ayah_en: from the right and from the left, in crowds?

ayah_ar: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍۢ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍۢ
ayah_en: Does every one of them aspire to be admitted into a Garden of Delight?

ayah_ar: كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَٰهُم مِّمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: Certainly not! They know quite well out of what We created them.

ayah_ar: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
ayah_en: But nay! I call to witness the Lord of the Easts and the Wests, that We have the power

ayah_ar: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
ayah_en: to replace them with others better than them: nothing can prevent Us from doing this,

ayah_ar: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
ayah_en: so leave them to indulge in vain idle talk and amuse themselves, until they face the Day which they have been promised,

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًۭا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍۢ يُوفِضُونَ
ayah_en: the Day when they shall come out of their graves in haste, as if they were racing to a goal,

ayah_ar: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌۭ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
ayah_en: with downcast eyes and faces distorted in shame; such is the Day which they are promised.

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
ayah_en: We sent Noah forth to his people, saying, "Warn your people before there comes upon them a grievous punishment."

ayah_ar: قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌ
ayah_en: \[Noah\] said, "My people! I am but a plain warner to you,

ayah_ar: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
ayah_en: that you should worship God \[alone\] and be conscious of Him. Pay heed to me.

ayah_ar: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
ayah_en: He will forgive your sins and will grant you respite till an appointed time. When the time appointed by God arrives, it cannot be postponed, if you only knew."

ayah_ar: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًۭا وَنَهَارًۭا
ayah_en: He said, "My Lord! I have called my people night and day

ayah_ar: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًۭا
ayah_en: but my pleas have only increased their aversion.

ayah_ar: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًۭا
ayah_en: Every time I have called to them, so that You might forgive them, they have only thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, grown obstinate, and given themselves up to arrogance.

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًۭا
ayah_en: Then I called them openly,

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًۭا
ayah_en: and spoke to them in public and in private."

ayah_ar: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًۭا
ayah_en: Then I said, "Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Surely He is the most forgiving.

ayah_ar: يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًۭا
ayah_en: He will send down abundant rain from the sky for you,

ayah_ar: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍۢ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّٰتٍۢ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَٰرًۭا
ayah_en: increase your wealth and sons; and grant you gardens and waterways.

ayah_ar: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًۭا
ayah_en: What is the matter with you that you deny the greatness of God,

ayah_ar: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
ayah_en: when He has created you through different stages of existence?

ayah_ar: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٍۢ طِبَاقًۭا
ayah_en: Do you not see how God has created the seven heavens one above another,

ayah_ar: وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًۭا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًۭا
ayah_en: and made the moon therein a light, and made the sun a lamp,

ayah_ar: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًۭا
ayah_en: how God has produced you from the earth and caused you to grow,

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًۭا
ayah_en: how He will then return you to it and bring you forth again,

ayah_ar: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًۭا
ayah_en: how God has spread the earth out for you

ayah_ar: لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًۭا فِجَاجًۭا
ayah_en: so that you may walk along its spacious paths?"

ayah_ar: قَالَ نُوحٌۭ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًۭا
ayah_en: Noah supplicated, "Lord, they have disobeyed me, and followed those whose wealth and children have only added to their ruin;

ayah_ar: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًۭا كُبَّارًۭا
ayah_en: and they have hatched a mighty plot,

ayah_ar: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّۭا وَلَا سُوَاعًۭا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًۭا
ayah_en: and they said \[to their followers\], "Do not ever abandon your deities: abandon neither Wadd, nor Suwa', and neither Yaghuth, nor Yauq nor Nasr!"

ayah_ar: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًۭا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلًۭا
ayah_en: They have led many astray; so lead the wrongdoers to further error."

ayah_ar: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًۭا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًۭا
ayah_en: They were drowned and sent to Hell for their misdeeds; they found no one to help them against God.

ayah_ar: وَقَالَ نُوحٌۭ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
ayah_en: Noah prayed, "O my Lord! Do not leave on earth a single one of those who deny the truth --

ayah_ar: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًۭا كَفَّارًۭا
ayah_en: if You leave any, they will misguide Your servants, and they will beget none but sinners and deniers of truth --

ayah_ar: رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًۭا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا
ayah_en: Lord! Forgive me and my parents and every true believer who enters my house, forgive all the believing men and believing women; and bestow no increase upon the wrongdoers except in ruin?

ayah_ar: قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًۭا
ayah_en: Say, "It has been revealed to me that a band of the jinn listened \[to the Quran\] and they said, "We have heard a really wonderful recital,

ayah_ar: يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦ ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًۭا
ayah_en: which guides to the right path; so we have believed in it and we will not associate anyone with our Lord,

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةًۭ وَلَا وَلَدًۭا
ayah_en: and exalted is the majesty of our Lord, He has taken neither a wife nor a son.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًۭا
ayah_en: And \[now we know\] that the foolish among us have been saying outrageous things about God.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًۭا
ayah_en: We had supposed that men and jinn would never utter a lie against God.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًۭا
ayah_en: Some men used to seek refuge with the jinn in the past, but that only increased their insolence.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًۭا
ayah_en: They thought, as you did, that God would never raise up anyone from the dead.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًۭا شَدِيدًۭا وَشُهُبًۭا
ayah_en: We sought to reach heaven, but found it filled with strong guards and flames --

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْءَانَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًۭا رَّصَدًۭا
ayah_en: we used to take up a position to listen, but whoever listens now finds a flaming fire lying in wait for him --

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًۭا
ayah_en: we cannot tell if this bodes evil to those who dwell on earth or whether their Lord intends to guide them.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدًۭا
ayah_en: Some of us are righteous, while others are not; we follow divergent paths.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُۥ هَرَبًۭا
ayah_en: We have realized that we could never thwart God on earth and that we would never be able to thwart Him by flight.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ ۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًۭا وَلَا رَهَقًۭا
ayah_en: When we heard the call to guidance, we believed in it. He who believes in his Lord has no fear of loss or of injustice.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا۟ رَشَدًۭا
ayah_en: Some of us are obedient while others are wrongdoers; it is the obedient who have found the right path,

ayah_ar: وَأَمَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا۟ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًۭا
ayah_en: but those who are wrongdoers will become the fuel of Hell."

ayah_ar: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسْتَقَٰمُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقًۭا
ayah_en: If they had followed the right path, We would have provided them with abundant rain --

ayah_ar: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًۭا صَعَدًۭا
ayah_en: so that We may test them by it -- whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord shall be sternly punished.

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّ ٱلْمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدًۭا
ayah_en: The mosques are for God's worship -- so do not invoke anyone else along with God --

ayah_ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا۟ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًۭا
ayah_en: when God's servant stood up to pray to Him, they pressed close to him in great numbers, almost stifling him.

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدًۭا
ayah_en: Say, "I call only upon my Lord and do not associate anyone else with Him."

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنِّى لَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّۭا وَلَا رَشَدًۭا
ayah_en: Say, "It is not in my power to cause you either harm or good?"

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنِّى لَن يُجِيرَنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٌۭ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا
ayah_en: Say, "Surely no one can protect me against God, nor can I find besides Him any place of refuge.

ayah_ar: إِلَّا بَلَٰغًۭا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦ ۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا
ayah_en: My duty is only to convey that which I receive from Him and His messages." For those who disobey God and His Messenger there is the fire of hell, wherein they will abide forever.

ayah_ar: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًۭا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًۭا
ayah_en: When they are confronted by what they have been promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.

ayah_ar: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌۭ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَمَدًا
ayah_en: Say, "I do not know whether what you are promised is imminent, or whether my Lord has set for it a far-off day.

ayah_ar: عَٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
ayah_en: He alone has knowledge of what is hidden. He reveals this to none,

ayah_ar: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍۢ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسْلُكُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ رَصَدًۭا
ayah_en: except the messenger whom He has chosen. He sends down guardians who walk before them and behind them,

ayah_ar: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا۟ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عَدَدًۢا
ayah_en: so that He may know that the messengers have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses all that is with them and He keeps count of all things.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ
ayah_en: O you who are wrapped up in your mantle,

ayah_ar: قُمِ ٱلَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا
ayah_en: stand up to pray for much of the night.

ayah_ar: نِّصْفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
ayah_en: It may be half the night or a little less than that

ayah_ar: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا
ayah_en: or a little more, but recite the Quran slowly and distinctly.

ayah_ar: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِى عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًۭا ثَقِيلًا
ayah_en: For We are about to send down to you a message of considerable gravity.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطْـًۭٔا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
ayah_en: Surely, getting up at night \[for worship\] is the most potent means of subduing the self and most suitable for the word \[of prayer\].

ayah_ar: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًۭا طَوِيلًۭا
ayah_en: You have by day prolonged occupations \[with Dawah work\].

ayah_ar: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًۭا
ayah_en: Remember the name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly.

ayah_ar: رَّبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًۭا
ayah_en: He is the Lord of the east and the west, there is no deity but Him, so take Him as your Guardian.

ayah_ar: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًۭا جَمِيلًۭا
ayah_en: Bear patiently with what they say, and ignore them politely.

ayah_ar: وَذَرْنِى وَٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُو۟لِى ٱلنَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
ayah_en: Leave it to Me to deal with the deniers, who live a life of comfort, and bear with them a little longer.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَآ أَنكَالًۭا وَجَحِيمًۭا
ayah_en: We have in store for them heavy fetters and a blazing Fire,

ayah_ar: وَطَعَامًۭا ذَا غُصَّةٍۢ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا
ayah_en: food that chokes and painful punishment

ayah_ar: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًۭا مَّهِيلًا
ayah_en: on the Day the earth and mountains shall shake and the mountains crumble into shifting sand dunes.

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًۭا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًۭا
ayah_en: We have sent a messenger who is a witness over you, just as We sent a messenger to Pharoah before you.

ayah_ar: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَٰهُ أَخْذًۭا وَبِيلًۭا
ayah_en: But Pharoah rebelled against the messenger, so We seized him with a strong, crushing grip.

ayah_ar: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًۭا يَجْعَلُ ٱلْوِلْدَٰنَ شِيبًا
ayah_en: If you persist in denying the truth how will you escape the Day that will turn the children's hair grey.

ayah_ar: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرٌۢ بِهِۦ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَفْعُولًا
ayah_en: The Day when the heavens will be rent asunder and God's promise shall be fulfilled.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌۭ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
ayah_en: This, surely, is an admonition. So let him who will, take the right path to his Lord.

ayah_ar: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَىِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ ۙ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ ۙ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًۭا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍۢ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًۭا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًۭا ۚ وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۢ
ayah_en: Your Lord knows that you stand up praying for nearly two-thirds of the night, or one-half of it and sometimes one third of it, as do others among your followers. God determines the measure of night and day. He knows that you will not be able to do it, so He has turned to you in mercy. Recite, then, as much of the Quran as is easy for you. He knows that there will be some among you who may be sick and others who will be travelling throughout the land seeking God's bounty, and yet others who may be fighting for the cause of God. So, recite, then as much of it as you are able, and be constant in prayer, and spend in charity, and give to God a goodly loan. For whatever good deed you send on before you for your souls, you will find it with God. It will be improved and richly rewarded by Him. Seek God's forgiveness, He is most forgiving, most merciful.

ayah_ar: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُدَّثِّرُ
ayah_en: O, you, wrapped in your cloak,

ayah_ar: قُمْ فَأَنذِرْ
ayah_en: arise and give warning!

ayah_ar: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ
ayah_en: Proclaim the glory of your Lord;

ayah_ar: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ
ayah_en: purify your garments;

ayah_ar: وَٱلرُّجْزَ فَٱهْجُرْ
ayah_en: shun uncleanness;

ayah_ar: وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ
ayah_en: do not bestow a favour in the expectation of receiving more in return;

ayah_ar: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصْبِرْ
ayah_en: and for the sake of your Lord, be patient.

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِى ٱلنَّاقُورِ
ayah_en: When the Trumpet is sounded,

ayah_ar: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ
ayah_en: that Day will be a hard and distressing Day.

ayah_ar: عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍۢ
ayah_en: It will not be easy for those who deny the truth.

ayah_ar: ذَرْنِى وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًۭا
ayah_en: Leave Me alone \[to deal\] with him whom I have created alone,

ayah_ar: وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُۥ مَالًۭا مَّمْدُودًۭا
ayah_en: and to whom I have granted resources in abundance,

ayah_ar: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًۭا
ayah_en: and sons to be by his side,

ayah_ar: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمْهِيدًۭا
ayah_en: and whom I have provided with every resource,

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ
ayah_en: and yet, he greedily desires that I give him even more!

ayah_ar: كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِءَايَٰتِنَا عَنِيدًۭا
ayah_en: By no means! He has been stubbornly hostile to Our revelation:

ayah_ar: سَأُرْهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا
ayah_en: I shall force him to endure a painful uphill climb!

ayah_ar: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
ayah_en: For he thought and he plotted --

ayah_ar: فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
ayah_en: and woe to him; how he plotted!

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
ayah_en: Let him be destroyed. How he calculated!

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
ayah_en: Then he looked round;

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
ayah_en: then he frowned and scowled,

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَٱسْتَكْبَرَ
ayah_en: and he turned his back and behaved arrogantly

ayah_ar: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌۭ يُؤْثَرُ
ayah_en: and said, "This is nothing but sorcery from the ancients.

ayah_ar: إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوْلُ ٱلْبَشَرِ
ayah_en: This is nothing but the word of a mortal!"

ayah_ar: سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ
ayah_en: Soon I will cast him into hell.

ayah_ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ
ayah_en: What could make you conceive what hell-fire is?

ayah_ar: لَا تُبْقِى وَلَا تَذَرُ
ayah_en: It does not allow anyone to live, and neither does it leave anyone to die;

ayah_ar: لَوَّاحَةٌۭ لِّلْبَشَرِ
ayah_en: it scorches the skin;

ayah_ar: عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ
ayah_en: there are nineteen \[angels\] in charge of it --

ayah_ar: وَمَا جَعَلْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةًۭ ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَيَزْدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِيمَٰنًۭا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌۭ وَٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًۭا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِىَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
ayah_en: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire. We have specified their number only as a trial for those who are bent on denying the truth, so that those who were given the Book might gain in certainty, and those who believe might increase in faith -- and so that neither those who have been given the Scripture nor the believers might have any doubts, and that those sick at heart and those who deny the truth might ask, "What does God mean by this parable?" In this way, God lets go astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. And none knows the forces of your Lord but He. This is but a Reminder for man.

ayah_ar: كَلَّا وَٱلْقَمَرِ
ayah_en: No, by the moon!

ayah_ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ
ayah_en: By the night when it departs.

ayah_ar: وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَآ أَسْفَرَ
ayah_en: By the dawn when it lightens!

ayah_ar: إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى ٱلْكُبَرِ
ayah_en: Surely, it is one of the gravest things,

ayah_ar: نَذِيرًۭا لِّلْبَشَرِ
ayah_en: it is a warning to man,

ayah_ar: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
ayah_en: alike to every one of you, who want to go forward or hang back.

ayah_ar: كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ
ayah_en: Every soul is held in pledge against its own deeds,

ayah_ar: إِلَّآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayah_en: except those of the right hand

ayah_ar: فِى جَنَّٰتٍۢ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
ayah_en: who in their gardens will be enquiring

ayah_ar: عَنِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
ayah_en: about the sinners.

ayah_ar: مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِى سَقَرَ
ayah_en: "What has brought you into the Fire of Hell ?"

ayah_ar: قَالُوا۟ لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ
ayah_en: and they shall reply, "We were not among those who prayed;

ayah_ar: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ ٱلْمِسْكِينَ
ayah_en: and we did not feed the poor;

ayah_ar: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلْخَآئِضِينَ
ayah_en: we indulged in vain arguments along with those who indulged in them;

ayah_ar: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
ayah_en: and we denied the Day of Judgement

ayah_ar: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلْيَقِينُ
ayah_en: until the Inevitable End \[death\] overtook us."

ayah_ar: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمْ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ
ayah_en: So no intercession will avail them.

ayah_ar: فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلتَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ
ayah_en: Then what is wrong with them that they turn away from admonition,

ayah_ar: كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌۭ مُّسْتَنفِرَةٌۭ
ayah_en: like frightened donkeys

ayah_ar: فَرَّتْ مِن قَسْوَرَةٍۭ
ayah_en: fleeing from a lion?

ayah_ar: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍۢ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًۭا مُّنَشَّرَةًۭ
ayah_en: Indeed, everyone of them desires to have sheets of revelations unfolded before them --

ayah_ar: كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ
ayah_en: No! They do not fear the Hereafter --

ayah_ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذْكِرَةٌۭ
ayah_en: but this is truly a reminder.

ayah_ar: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
ayah_en: Let him who will take heed:

ayah_ar: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ
ayah_en: they will only take heed if God so wills: He is the Lord who is worthy to be feared: the Lord of forgiveness.

ayah_ar: لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ
ayah_en: By the Day of Resurrection,

ayah_ar: وَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلنَّفْسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
ayah_en: and by the self-reproaching soul!

ayah_ar: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ
ayah_en: Does man think that We cannot \[resurrect him and\] bring his bones together again?

ayah_ar: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
ayah_en: Indeed, We have the power to restore his very finger tips!

ayah_ar: بَلْ يُرِيدُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
ayah_en: Yet man wants to deny what is ahead of him:

ayah_ar: يَسْـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ
ayah_en: he asks, "When is this Day of Resurrection to be?"

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلْبَصَرُ
ayah_en: But \[on that Day\], when mortal sight is confounded,

ayah_ar: وَخَسَفَ ٱلْقَمَرُ
ayah_en: and the moon is eclipsed,

ayah_ar: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ
ayah_en: when the sun and the moon are brought together,

ayah_ar: يَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ ٱلْمَفَرُّ
ayah_en: on that Day man will ask, "Where can I escape?"

ayah_ar: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ
ayah_en: But there is nowhere to take refuge:

ayah_ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمُسْتَقَرُّ
ayah_en: on that Day, to your Lord alone is the recourse.

ayah_ar: يُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
ayah_en: On that Day, man will be told of all that he has sent before and what he has left behind.

ayah_ar: بَلِ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٌۭ
ayah_en: Indeed, man shall be a witness against himself,

ayah_ar: وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ
ayah_en: in spite of all the excuses he may offer.

ayah_ar: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
ayah_en: \[Prophet\], do not move your tongue too fast in your attempt to learn this revelation:

ayah_ar: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُۥ وَقُرْءَانَهُۥ
ayah_en: We Ourself shall see to its collection and recital.

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعْ قُرْءَانَهُۥ
ayah_en: When We have recited it, follow its words attentively;

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُۥ
ayah_en: and then, it will be for Us to make its meaning clear.

ayah_ar: كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ
ayah_en: Truly, you love immediate gain

ayah_ar: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ
ayah_en: and neglect the Hereafter.

ayah_ar: وُجُوهٌۭ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ نَّاضِرَةٌ
ayah_en: Some faces will be radiant on that Day,

ayah_ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌۭ
ayah_en: looking towards their Lord;

ayah_ar: وَوُجُوهٌۭ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَاسِرَةٌۭ
ayah_en: and some faces will on that Day be gloomy,

ayah_ar: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌۭ
ayah_en: dreading some great affliction.

ayah_ar: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِىَ
ayah_en: But when \[man's soul\] reaches the throat,

ayah_ar: وَقِيلَ مَنْ ۜ رَاقٍۢ
ayah_en: and when it is asked: "Could any magician save him now?";

ayah_ar: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلْفِرَاقُ
ayah_en: and he knows that it is the time of parting;

ayah_ar: وَٱلْتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
ayah_en: when his legs are brought together \[when affliction is combined with affliction\];

ayah_ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمَسَاقُ
ayah_en: on that Day he will be driven towards your Lord!

ayah_ar: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ
ayah_en: He neither believed nor prayed,

ayah_ar: وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
ayah_en: but rejected the Truth and turned away!

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ
ayah_en: Then he went off to his people, swaggering.

ayah_ar: أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
ayah_en: Woe to you, \[O man!\], yes, woe to you.

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰٓ
ayah_en: Again, woe to you, \[O man!\], yes, woe to you!

ayah_ar: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتْرَكَ سُدًى
ayah_en: Does man, then, think that he is to be left to himself, to go about at will?

ayah_ar: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةًۭ مِّن مَّنِىٍّۢ يُمْنَىٰ
ayah_en: Was he not once a drop of ejaculated semen,

ayah_ar: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةًۭ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
ayah_en: which then became a leech-like clot; then God shaped and fashioned him in due proportion,

ayah_ar: فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ
ayah_en: fashioning out of him the two sexes, the male and the female?

ayah_ar: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحْۦِىَ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ
ayah_en: Then is He not able to bring the dead back to life?

ayah_ar: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَٰنِ حِينٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًۭٔا مَّذْكُورًا
ayah_en: Was there not a period of time when man was nothing worth mentioning?

ayah_ar: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍۢ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا
ayah_en: We created man from a drop of mingled fluid so that We might try him; We gave him hearing and sight;

ayah_ar: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًۭا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
ayah_en: We showed him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.

ayah_ar: إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَٰلًۭا وَسَعِيرًا
ayah_en: \[Now,\] behold, for those who deny the truth, We have prepared chains, iron collars and a blazing fire, but

ayah_ar: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍۢ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
ayah_en: the righteous shall drink from a cup mixed with the coolness of kafur,

ayah_ar: عَيْنًۭا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًۭا
ayah_en: a spring from which God's servants will drink, making it gush forth in branches.

ayah_ar: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًۭا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًۭا
ayah_en: They keep their vows and fear a day the woe of which will spread far and wide;

ayah_ar: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًۭا وَيَتِيمًۭا وَأَسِيرًا
ayah_en: they give food, despite their love for it, to the poor and orphans and captives,

ayah_ar: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءًۭ وَلَا شُكُورًا
ayah_en: saying, "We feed you for the sake of God alone, we seek neither recompense nor thanks from you.

ayah_ar: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًۭا قَمْطَرِيرًۭا
ayah_en: Truly, we fear from our Lord a woefully grim Day."

ayah_ar: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمْ نَضْرَةًۭ وَسُرُورًۭا
ayah_en: Therefore, God will ward off from them the woes of that Day, and make them find brightness and joy,

ayah_ar: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةًۭ وَحَرِيرًۭا
ayah_en: and their reward for being patient will be a Garden and silk \[clothing\].

ayah_ar: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًۭا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًۭا
ayah_en: Reclining upon couches, they will find therein neither the heat of the sun nor bitter, biting cold,

ayah_ar: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًۭا
ayah_en: the shading branches of trees will come down low over them, and their clusters of fruit, will hang down where they are the easiest to reach.

ayah_ar: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٍۢ مِّن فِضَّةٍۢ وَأَكْوَابٍۢ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا۠
ayah_en: Vessels of silver and goblets of pure crystal will be passed round among them

ayah_ar: قَوَارِيرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةٍۢ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًۭا
ayah_en: and gleaming silver goblets which have been filled to the exact measure,

ayah_ar: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًۭا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
ayah_en: and they will be given a cup to drink flavoured with ginger,

ayah_ar: عَيْنًۭا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًۭا
ayah_en: from a flowing spring called Salsabil.

ayah_ar: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌۭ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًۭا مَّنثُورًۭا
ayah_en: They will be attended by youths who will not age -- when you see them you will think them to be like sprinkled pearls --

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًۭا وَمُلْكًۭا كَبِيرًا
ayah_en: wherever you look, you will see bliss and a great kingdom:

ayah_ar: عَٰلِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌۭ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌۭ ۖ وَحُلُّوٓا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍۢ وَسَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًۭا طَهُورًا
ayah_en: they will wear green garments of fine silk and rich brocade. They will be adorned with silver bracelets. And their Lord will give them a pure drink.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَآءًۭ وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
ayah_en: This is your reward. Your endeavour is fully acknowledged.

ayah_ar: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَنزِيلًۭا
ayah_en: Truly, it is We who have revealed to you the Quran, a gradual revelation.

ayah_ar: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ ءَاثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًۭا
ayah_en: So wait patiently for the command of your Lord, and do not yield to anyone among them who is sinful or ungrateful;

ayah_ar: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةًۭ وَأَصِيلًۭا
ayah_en: and glorify your Lord morning and evening;

ayah_ar: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَٱسْجُدْ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًۭا طَوِيلًا
ayah_en: and during the night prostrate ourself before Him, and extol His glory for a long part of the night.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمْ يَوْمًۭا ثَقِيلًۭا
ayah_en: Those people \[who are unmindful of God\] aspire for immediate gains, and put behind them a Heavy Day.

ayah_ar: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
ayah_en: It was We who created them and made their constitution strong, but if We wish we can replace them with others like them.

ayah_ar: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌۭ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًۭا
ayah_en: This is a reminder. Let whoever wishes, take the right path to his Lord.

ayah_ar: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًۭا
ayah_en: But you cannot will it unless God wills \[to show you that way\] -- God is indeed all-knowing and wise --

ayah_ar: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا
ayah_en: He admits whoever He will into His grace and has prepared a painful punishment for the evil doers.

ayah_ar: وَٱلْمُرْسَلَٰتِ عُرْفًۭا
ayah_en: By the winds sent forth in swift succession,

ayah_ar: فَٱلْعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصْفًۭا
ayah_en: and then storming on with a tempest's force,

ayah_ar: وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشْرًۭا
ayah_en: and the rain-spreading winds,

ayah_ar: فَٱلْفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرْقًۭا
ayah_en: separating one from another,

ayah_ar: فَٱلْمُلْقِيَٰتِ ذِكْرًا
ayah_en: by those who bring down the reminder,

ayah_ar: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا
ayah_en: to excuse some and warn others:

ayah_ar: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٌۭ
ayah_en: that which you have been promised shall be fulfilled.

ayah_ar: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ
ayah_en: When the stars lose their light,

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتْ
ayah_en: and when the sky is rent asunder,

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ
ayah_en: and when the mountains crumble into dust

ayah_ar: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ
